The Sistine Chapel is beyond compare and I sat down and looked up and listened to the fascinating information behind it's creation. One of the lovely guides told me to look out for the Gallery of Maps which was definitely a highlight. It was all great! Alas I had booked two tours originally, for my Mum and me, but she could not join me in Italy. One of the guides said I could maybe call your organisation to see about getting another discounted guide somewhere for me but I didn't get round to it, but it was kind of them to suggest this. data.author: Arnaud – France

data.title: Stars awarded for the activity itself
data.message:
The Vatican Museum, including the Sistine Chapel, was in itself very magnificent to see and was full of stunning exhibits of great historic significance.

Even visiting in November the crowds at the Vatican were vast and we found the experience initially very stressful. We had to find the Get Your Guide meeting point through very busy streets which was only possible through the help of on street independent ticket promotors. When we arrived the GYG tour guides took the group to the group reservations entry point, the queue for this snaked round and round and round and we waited over an hour. I’m not sure “skip the line” is quite an accurate description and shouldn’t be sold as such as you simply can’t avoid queues due to the security check line. We paid nearly double the regular admission price to get tickets that were supposed to take the stress and time away from buying an entry ticket but it didn’t achieve this, so was disappointed by that but enjoyed the activity itself.

data.title: Vatican art treasures are fantastic. An heritage not to be missed.
data.message:
Positive points: a fantastic experience with a unique concentration of art, especially the paintings. Good surprise to see very interesting and unexpected modern pieces. Excellent and impressive organisation by the Vatican.
Negative points: the crowd of groups, unability to really feel the depth/spirit of chapelle Sixtine, and the guards inside the museums (some are very unpleasant and unwilling to help). I think the museum's should claim more what they are: the treasures and ongoing heritage of the Catholic Church.
To improve: the move from the yard after the galleries to Saint Pierre. The quality of the souvenirs. A free map would be appreciated.

data.message: I do not know how the Vatican manages their visitors but on the day I went it felt like we all were cattle with no room to move or change route until after the Sistene Chapel- which was sos full of people one couldn’t even see the ground.
data.author: Amy – United States

data.title: It was actually not skip the queue as we had to wait long hours
data.author: Joseph – Sweden

data.message: Having seen the tremendous queue of hundreds of people without tickets, so glad we had pre-booked with Get-Your-Guide
data.author: Alan – United Kingdom

data.message: very excellant. As their kind service mind i could into the musium even thought late arrival. I am very thanks to her again and again.
data.author: kyunghwan – South Korea

data.title: It works like a charm
data.message: The line was very long, it would be stupid to stand there and waste prescious time!
data.author: Stanley – Netherlands

data.title: Eh...
data.message: It was good to have the escort through the line ticket, but it wasn’t really necessary on this day. I wanted to be sure and glad I had it just in case. The real lines are inside the museums. I would’ve appreciated the getyourguide after she escorted everyone through checkin to say goodbye to everyone at the escalator, but literally she disappeared. I’ve had similar tickets like this from other companies (and I knew paid only for the escort ) but the pass off into the experience felt sloppy. Just a simple, “have a nice time in the museums and Sistine Chapel...” would’ve made this be a five star experience. So, that’s my opinion. Also, a couple of the guys in our tour had shorts on, even though it’s noted on your website and others to not wear them (or be denied access into some church areas) and I mentioned it to the getyourguides, so they could warn them... just in case, they didn’t care. So... I made no mention of it, but it seemed like a general lack of customer experience care...
data.author: Wayne – United States

data.title: Did "exactly what it said on the tin" Efficient and effective service.
data.message: It would have been helpful to know the meeting place was halfway on a set of steps between one street and another. Directly opposite the entrsnce to the Vatican museums. But this is a minor observation.
data.author: Ian – United Kingdom

data.message: Really worth the money, the line was huge! It would be nice if we had a guide to lead us and explain some stuff, because the Vatican is big and with lots of things to see, but we really enjoyed it!
data.author: Chris – Greece

data.message: Unbelievable how many people were there. It was like a Cattle car. You could not move. If you stopped people would just push by you. Only good thing was we didn’t have to wait to get into St. Peter’s after.
data.author: Don – United States

data.title: Definitely get when doing a day trip.
data.message:
I was only in Rome for one day so I booked the guide to save time. I was unsure it was going to be necessary, but I found that it transformed a 3hr wait into a 15min one.
I was also glad to have some assistance getting through the museum entrance since it was quite chaotic.
data.author: Eric – United States

data.title: Avoided v long queue
data.message: No problem. Went straight in, avoiding huge queue. Would not have visited otherwise.
data.author: Susan – United Kingdom

data.title: Easy to locate meeting point, fast entry no hassle great
data.author: Val – United Kingdom

data.title: Good service and organised guides
data.message: Everything went extremely well until we were through to the other side of the turnstiles, then our guides just disappeared without word. At the meet and greet no comment had been made as to what would happen once inside, however we coped. Thanks for getting us in so swiftly.
data.author: MARTYN – United Kingdom

data.title: Great to leave the qeue behind with the fast track ticket.
data.message:
Worth the extra money. Museums are very busy and Sistine chapel at the very end. Worth waiting for to see its ceiling You could spend hours in the museums depending on your interest. One of the museums has a great area on Egypt and its artefacts including mummies which ties in with the Roman fascination with Egypt.

Overall not to be missed and a must if you are spending a few days in Rome.
data.author: William – Ireland

data.message: you should have on your website that headphones are not included with this tour. We would of liked to have known so we could bring our won.
data.author: Darryl – Canada

data.message:
I arrived earlier than the hour i booked the ticket...but the girls recived me in a group that was scheduled earlier...witch was very nice from their part.
I had only the skip the line entry..not a guided tour.
Overall impresion regarding this museum is that is overated ..and when you get to the sixtine chapel you are not allowed to take picture inside...much more beautiful is the St Peter basilica and plaza...which is free entry
data.author: Gabriela – Romania

data.message: So well organised. No queuing. Would definitely use get your guide again. Thank you!
data.author: Emma – United Kingdom

data.title: Vatican On Your Own At Your Pace
data.message: Don't miss visiting the Vatican if in Rome. You do have to dedicate almost a full day for the visit, albeit if you take a morning tour, you can be done for a late 2 pm lunch, which you can enjoy in one of the many trattoria in the small streets surrounding the Vatican. In the Vatican, you will visit numerous rooms and exhibits, filled with art and treasures. It was ideal to have taken a Get Your Guide Tour to know where to queue. They obtained the entry tickets on our behalf.
data.author: Catherine – Canada

data.message: Exactly what I needed. Tickets and to skip the line. I didn’t want a guide of to do the long tour so I selected this option. You meet the guide they walk you in and give u the tickets and you tour on your own. Without looking at everything it still took a little over 2 hrs for me to get finished
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.message:
When we arrived at the meeting point other guides had to point out where the GetYourGuide people were, it was not easy to spot. They checked our names but no further information was given.
The queu was enormous, even with the skip the line ticket we had to wait anouther hour. Everything was very slow.
The audio guide is useless, sometimes it’s difficult to spot the numbers in the room and select the right commentary.
It was not really my cup of tea, perhaps other people who don’t mind queuing up and not being informed properly.
data.author: Édit – United Kingdom

data.title: Not good.
data.message: Dropped us us off and left.
data.author: Elizabeth

data.message: Fast paced and no time to take everything in.
data.author: Michael – Ireland

data.title: Exellent but crowded
data.message: Definitely worth seeing, but they let far to many people into the museum. It’s extremely crowded and noisy. Maybe too much a money maschine for theVatican?
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Denmark

data.title: Excellent
data.message: Very good...
data.author: Gloria – United Kingdom

data.message:
Very bad experience!
The skip-the-line proposed by GetYourGuide was useless. To avoid...
data.author: Alexandre – Switzerland

data.message: Defiantly worth buying a fast track ticket. 2 of us went in the beginning of October and the queue to get into the Vatican Muesem went all the way down the road. We walked straight through the fast track entrance, we showed the guard our ticket, he scanned the code and let us straight in.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.message: Good quality! We can skip the line so we save time. Thx!
data.author: Bianka – Hungary

data.message:
Stunning view (The Vatican).

Remember Drink plenty of water, gum, Deodorant and very light clothes. Not a woll sweather and Winther jeans. Good light shoes. Many steps an many people at noon. See everything very early in the morning, dont be last minute.
The map from this App showed ud the private gate to the Popes private guests, so we were lucky to be in very good time. The fast Lane was crowded with peple going in the wrong direction! The Vatican controle people stressed people, Avanti Avanti!! (And we were walking very fast already to about the bad smell of the tourists. I will never do it again no matter how stunning the paintings were. Sorry. Too many people and no air = a finnish sauna.
data.author: Pia Christine – Denmark

data.title: great tour
data.message: Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel is a place definitely worth to see. Unfortunately this place is overcrowded afternoon and theres no time for enjoy this marvelous place, but its a sin to be in Rome and dont visit this place :-)
data.author: Hubert – Iceland

data.message: Arrive before 10am and you'll miss the long lines to get in.
data.author: Sarah – United Kingdom

data.title: Fast. The person were nice. Good.
data.author: Xiaowen – Italy

data.title: We saved about 3h by skipping the line
data.message:
I would definitely recommend these pre tickets. The line for the museum went half around the Vatican and we walked 20 minutes past waiting people before we walked right inside with these tickets.
The experience inside the museums was breathtaking even though it was very crowded in some parts.
Highly recommended!!
data.author: Sarah – Germany

data.title: Quick Access to everything
data.message: Super cheap, easy access into the Vatican. Extremely easy and quick access to the entire Vatican, walk through everywhere and even walk right on in to the Basilica.
data.author: Kevin – United States

data.title: Terrible
data.message: So much money just to by pass the crowd and left on our own to visit this is not we expected for $122.00
data.author: Lise – Canada

data.title: Skip the Queue's for some famous views!
data.message: Booking ahead was definitely the right move to avoid hours of queuing. Of course, there are still lots of people visiting at the same time, but that's to be expected. Soaking up the history and the art of the Vatican City is something that my wife and I have wanted to do for a long time. It does get a bit hectic around the Sistine Chapel, but still amazing to visit.
data.author: Barry – United Kingdom

data.title: too much to take in one go
data.author: Dominika – Poland

data.title: Too rushed. Organisation should have been better re meeting point.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Book the ticket for 3pm we did not enter until 4pm
data.message:
This is a very expensive service (the tickets at the Vatican's website are 17euros, here 40), so at least you expect that you will enter the Museums on time. That was not the case and we had to queue for almost one hour. I dont see the value adding of bookin the tickets here and I sincerely think I deserve a refund given the time we had to wait to enter.
The lady in charge of our group was very nice, though. And it was not her fault.
data.author: Gonzalo – Spain

data.message: Be aware of the guys on the street trying to upsell you on stuff. Skip the line was awesome, the Vatican itself was overrated in my opinion. Too many people, not enough air circulation.
data.author: Tami – United States

data.title: good entry, and got in slightly early as it was late in the day
data.message:
The sistine chapel is too crowded.Compared to St Marks in Venice it seems like a cattle call

Work on changing that if you can
data.author: rodney – United States

data.title: We did not wait for 3 hours but still 1 hour with people pushing.
data.message: Three times the price of the ticket from vatican's website, you'd better book early. This overpriced ticket does not worth it. Besides people pushing and not respecting the queue, I do not recommend this activity.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Switzerland

data.title: Cut the line from 3-4 hours to 1 one-half hours -- not much else.
data.message:
We bought this service thinking it would get us into the Vatican museum without waiting in a long line. This is probably the only way to save hours in purchasing tickets and then standing in line to get inside but the experience leaves a lot to be desired.

The crowds were oppressive and the constant jostling took all the joy out of the experience. I have no solution; just too many people confined in the museum at one time.
data.author: William – United States

data.message: We had no guide we just got Fast track inside (which is a must) we paid for Audio guide inside (go at your own speed) spend 4 hours inside and still never seen it all. Food/drinks inside very cheep. Definitely recommend Lisa & Fergal, Ireland.
data.author: Lisa – United Kingdom

data.message: Amazing, Stefan our guide was incredible!!! 100% would recommend this tour
data.author: claire – United Kingdom

data.message: Fast track entry is a must. Really enjoyed all of the art and the beautiful chapel, ticket works from your phone
data.author: Aaron – Ireland

data.message: best among all the trips i booked through the guided tour. very well organized. clear communication. easy to find meeting point.
data.author: Samiulla – United Arab Emirates

data.title: good experience, good organization
data.message:
It was an amazing experience to see the Vatikan museum and Sistine Chapel.
The organization was good, the exhibition itself great.
I got a lot of impressions and can recommend to all of you.
data.author: Ingo – Germany

data.title: Quick on time service as advertised!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Costa Rica

data.message: The fast and troubleless entrance to the Vatican museums.
data.author: Stanimir – Bulgaria

data.title: Great service to help you enjoy a wonderful experience in the Vatican.
data.message: Finding the meeting point was manageable, and the guides helped us through the chaotic entrance area. Skipping the line was worth every penny.
data.author: william – United States

data.message: Should also mention meeting point as the mid-point of steps leading to street level and the pedestrian crossing for entrance to the Vatican Museum.
data.author: Anthony – United Kingdom

data.message: the entrance to the museum on the fast track took 5 minutes, while the usual queue stretched for hundreds of meters. This allowed us to save more time to view the museum. Awesome!
data.author: Yana – Germany

data.message: there are so many people allowed in you can not look at anything and it is very claustrophobic.
data.author: Judith – United Kingdom

data.title: Wonderful and a very easy App to use.
data.message: Thank you very much for this App. The “direction” feature was super helpful and easy to use.
data.author: Jerald – United States

data.title: Vatican/Sistine chapel tour
data.message: It would be better if the transporation was included and if you had a personal tour guide instead of audio. It was great to get a discount on souvenirs with your tour ticket
data.author: Patricia – Italy

data.title: The museum was incredible and the Sistine chapel was worth it alone!
data.author: Erin – Canada

data.title: Very crowed but the lines moved. We waited 30 minutes in the short lin
data.author: Marie – United States

data.title: Too many people felt like you were just being pushed along
data.author: Catriona – United Kingdom

data.title: the experience of seeing the vatican & Sistine Chapel was so exciting
data.message: being able to visit the Vatican & sistine Chapel was made easy by using getyourguide.com.
data.author: Charles – Italy

data.title: Saved me a lot of time as i only had limited time availability!
data.message: Worth every euro to skip the huge line!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Belgium

data.message: Great setting. We only had the skip the line access to get on. We were left on our own to explore. Great price for this event. I would do it again
data.author: Geoff – United States

data.title: Great experience
data.message: Still had to wait a small queu but it was faster after all
data.author: SOTIRIOS – Greece

data.title: Skip the lines. It makes sense. DEFINITELY better than waiting!!!
data.message: these guides do a great job. very reliable, and low fuss. would definitely reccomend
data.author: David – Australia

data.title: Great service
data.message: Great service
data.author: Michelle

data.title: Terrible waste of time
data.message: We paid for fast track entry, I fully understood that we would still have to enter an entry line but the whole system was unorganised and chaotic. Would have been quicker to get into the general admissions line but unfortunately we couldn't get out money back. Waste of time.
data.author: Gemma – United Kingdom

data.title: So called fast track - was total chaos !
data.message: Absolute chaos! Took hour and half to gain entry was totally chaotic no consideration for safety crowds of people pushing forward rather scary to be honest. Then given audio headset - no tour as such! would not recommend
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.message: brilliant organisation... excellent value...great to not spend our whole day queueing
data.author: Jane – United Kingdom

data.title: the fast track line was really short and we were in within 10 minutes
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Spain

data.title: Crowded
data.message: We booked the tickets with GetYourGuide and the entrance was smoothy and quick, fast track really works. It took 10 min to be in ready for the museum. This ticket DOES NOT includes tour guide ( just because this comment is about the museum not thecompany) we just thought go first to the sixtine chapel, and we found out that you have to visit 10 rooms before that ( compulsory) there were roughly 300 people trying to pass through one room to other room, no air, only people looking for the sixtine chapel. It took 50 min to get there!!!! When we arrived we just were exhausted... of course we dont have more time to visit the museum.. the company was ok and organised
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Fast track..?
data.message: I don't know till now what fast track was about. We still had to wait for 1 hour to enter the museum. Apart from that, the group instructors were helpful.
data.author: Evangelos – Greece

data.title: Good
data.message: Good
data.author: Konstantinos – Greece

data.message: Instead of fast track, we ended up queing for 1 hour before we finally got in! One of the guides told us we would get 10% discount as a way of apologizing for queuing so long however nothing came out of it. There were so much people squeezed in the corridors of the museum that my son could hardly breathe!!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Switzerland

data.title: Superfast "Skip the Line" entry a Very interesting walk in the Vatican
data.author: BJORN – Sweden

data.title: Had to queue for over an hour to get in which was disappointing
data.author: Tiffanie – United Kingdom

data.title: Skip the line here means to skip to another line.
data.message: Skiping the line has nothing to do with speeding up getting into the Vatican museums. It basically moves you to another line where you have to wait over hour anyway. I don't know, how long you would wait withiut the ticket, but with a ticket you wait crazily long also.
data.author: Daniel – Czech Republic

data.title: too crowded
data.message: the Vatican was amazing, beautiful artwork and all... but there's too many people touring it at the same time. Very difficult to actually enjoy.
data.author: Renaud – Canada

data.message: We are a family of five and my mom, being in a wheelchair, we had a very quick and efficient access to the museum. The drawback though was the fact that we did not have access to the whole museum and missed the most beautiful rooms and corridors. At least we got to enter the Sistine chapel.
data.author: Johanne – Canada

data.title: Great skip the line option!
data.message: Super easy meeting point and you get escorted right in the group entrance. Once through security your guide gives you your ticket and your off!
data.author: Anna – United States

data.title: A must to avoid long lines
data.author: Dawn – United States

data.message: Much too crowded for my liking, although it's to be expected at this crowded tourist attraction.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Canada

data.title: I'm not religious, but you have to see it. Amazing!
data.message: Went to see this, and the skip the lines deal is the only way to go. Masses of people and the only way to go! Don't line up!
data.author: Colin – United Kingdom

data.message: It was great to be able to skip the line as it gets very busy at the Vatican
data.author: Nathan – Australia

data.title: I love skip the line!
data.message: My husband and I decided at the last minute to go to the Vatican. I saw Get Your Guide tickets online and bought them. I can’t tell you how happy we were that we had these tickets. The wait was between 2 and 3 hours long! We got right inside! I would recommend to everyone to get these tickets and avoid the lines.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: fast track AND [a tour guide] would be a much better option
data.message:
We had to meet at 9:30 in the AM, and after waiting for group stickers and entry, we entered at the same time as people that we walked with to the vatican.... that didn't pay (decent amount) of money for fast track. Kind of a slap in the face to pay the money and not reap the reward. Nothing against the guides, just luck of the draw with crowds and morning time.

Plus, I would say to get a guide. The fast track alone wasn't worth the money
data.author: Benjamin – United States

data.title: Get in fast, to still be part of an enrmous croud slowly flowing ...
data.message: The ticket helped to get in on the fast track. Please be Aware, getting in only saves you from the waiting in line to get ion. It does not safe you from being squeesed in an endless snake of People from all over the world, being moved through the vatican Museum at the snakes pace, with almost no real chance to walk, stop and observe with your own pace. (at loeat not on all ways leading to and from the sitine chappel. The sistine chappel, you better buy a book to explore the details. Which I did.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Germany

data.message:
The process of having GetYourGuide's assistance in gaining quick access to the Vatican Museums worked very well and was much appreciated, especially given the very long line of non-ticket holders which we were able to avoid.

Our only complaint is that the instructions about the meeting place were not as clearly detailed as they could very easily have been.

Rather than directing customers to the location by having to find intersecting streets, which are not well marked, it would have been much easier to simply indicate that the GetYourGuide representatives, with a red flag, would be found on the steps DIRECTLY OPPOSITE THE ENTRANCE TO THE MUSEUMS, which, once you get there, can hardly be missed.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Canada

data.title: More than meet the eyes!
data.message: Quick access, that’s exactly what you’re paying for. Recommended if you value your precious time!
data.author: Jonathan – Canada

data.title: Guide could not speak good English
data.message: Didn’t realize other tour companies got priority entry over others. City Wonders got priority!!
data.author: Kathleen – United States

data.title: Can recommend the skip-the-line!
data.message: Glad we booked our tickets via the internet, as we wouldn't have wanted to join the long, long queue in the hot sun! Excellent system. Wished we'd booked a later time to see the basilica in the afternoon, as there was so much to see in the museums.
data.author: christine – United Kingdom

data.title: Worth it.
data.message: The lines for the Vatican are unholy. Definitely worth buying this and paying a bit more to skip the lines. The group leads you inside without any issue.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: Excellent visit. Skipped the queue for tickets, not for security.
data.author: Gabriele – United Kingdom

data.title: STILL HAD TO WAIT 20 MINS TO GET IN.
data.author: Paul – United Kingdom

data.message:
Excellent way to see the Vatican
Skip the lines and beat the queues
data.author: mark – United Kingdom

data.title: Amasing
data.message: Amasing experience, excellent tickets, avoided the main queue.
data.author: Caroline – United Kingdom

data.title: To many prople impossible to see anything
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Israel

data.title: Excellent Knowledgeable Guide Irina emchenko , proud of her and Oranis
data.message: Very professional Oraniser, must capture this tour
data.author: Uday – India

data.title: It's just a way to skip the queue, not actual guide.
data.message: Process was simple and fine.
data.author: Melinda – United States

data.title: More like an all day activity!
data.message: Absolutely amazing! This was advertised as a 2 hours long tour, though. That could only be the case if you race through without seeing much at all! It took us almost 6 hours even though we still skipped some of the galleries! You need to give yourself time to really appreciate it.
data.author: Tiberiu – United Kingdom

data.title: Very accommodating
data.message: I stupidly booked the wrong date when booking on my phone but the guides were lovely ( Marga, Claudia and Alessia - thank you so much) and as there was space on the tour let us join in as we were only in Rome for the weekend! Great to queue jump but still takes some time getting through security and very crowded but that was expected.
data.author: jemma – United Kingdom

data.title: Busy but good to see
data.message: We were not wowed by the Vatican museums and it was extremely busy. You couldn't take photos in the Sistine Chapel. The assistance for disabled people was extremely good but there was a lack of food options.
data.author: Henry – United Kingdom

data.title: Easy access getting in. Line bypass was efficient.
data.author: Farhan – Canada

data.title: Worth booking in advance to avoid the very lengthy queues.Easy to book
data.author: Barbara – United Kingdom

data.message: Woman at the meeting point were unfriendly
data.author: Yvonne – Germany

data.message: best option queues are so long
data.author: Christopher – United Kingdom

data.title: Quick and easy access avioding long wait in queue
data.author: John – United Kingdom

data.title: Museum AWESOME - Chapel to crowded
data.message: The fast lane was worth ! We came super fast in. The Museum itself is stunning and beautiful. The Sistine Chapel was super crowded. And for me not as impressive as the museum.
data.author: Ana – Switzerland

data.title: Great way to skip the long line for tickets to Vatican Museum
data.author: Jocelyn – Canada

data.title: Nice Inside Attractions
data.message: The attractions themselves were easy to manoeuvre and the fast track really was quite fast. A group of four adults tired from days of walking, and we still saw all we wanted to see and some extras in about 3 hours.
data.author: Hannah – Germany

data.title: challenging experience
data.message: While its a fast pass ticket, it has to be noted that by no means it is a fast pass experience inside the museums! There has to be a disclaimer that this experience is usually very busy and it doesnt mean getting through the museums faster. Also another very challenging thing is all the “tourist helpers” outside messing with you and trying to force you to follow a guided tour.
data.author: Michalis – Cyprus

data.title: Excellent way to skip the line !
data.message: We booked this no guide skip the line ticket for Vatican museums and Sistine Chapel as we booked the earlier morning saint peters dome climb tour and wanted to see Sistine chapel before heading off to citavecchia . You would need to finish dome climb tour then exit and meet for skip the line ticket for this. Worked out perfect for me because I wanted to see Saint Peters Basilica very first !
data.author: David – United States

data.title: Overcrowded, hot and at times terrifying.
data.message: The map with the audio guide had zero bearing on the Vatican museum layout. The sheep-herding of people into ever smaller galleries to get to the Sistine chapel was nightmarish. I was literally elbowed by people and nearly trampled. There are no early exits, so we were stuck. It was horrible. The Vatican needs to be less greedy and manage their crowds much better.
data.author: Ingrid – United States

data.title: Loved the place
data.message: The guides were okay but they were not so talkative to everyone or explain what was to happen. The crowd was big and if you were at the back you couldn’t hear her of what little she had to say. Communication is a key to such a big crowd of people.
data.author: Uzma – United Kingdom

data.title: Too Many People
data.message: The fast-track entry will save you an hour in line. However overall experience to the museum was terrible. You literally can't move freely inside. It took us 3-4 hours to finish the shortcut course, doing the full course could take 5+ hours including the garden. The collections are good but the only most important thing you shouldn't miss here is the Sistine Chapel.
data.author: Alvin – Philippines

data.title: Unnesesarry expence
data.message: With this fast track entry we still had to wait an hour to get in. Regular line honestly moved quicker. The only benefit of this service is that they will give you a ticket to go in otherwise it would be addition 10 min wait.
data.author: Tatsiana – United States

data.message: Too many people, too crowded. Felt as if we were carried along with the crowd. In Sistine chapel guards were shushing people and shouting "no photos, no filming, move into the middle". Didn't enjoy it at all, wish I hadn't gone.
data.author: Sheila – United Kingdom

data.title: Great value, so glad we skipped the lines!
data.author: Claire – United States

data.title: For a skip the line, the line roof 30 minutes
data.message: The Vatican was amazing. we were taking so many photos we didn't bother listening to the narrative. The crowd was insane however. You felt like you were being pushed through. It was difficult to get the photo as so many people kept walking through the shot. I get that it's a popular tour but damn...
data.author: Walter – United States

data.message: Get Your Guide just organised the entry. After entering the building we were on our own.
data.author: Edward – Switzerland

data.title: Saved a lot of time, but limited guidance only
data.message: Very helpful for quick access to the museum. I would, however, appreciate very brief (3-5 minutes) introduction / recommendation where to go there, how much time is needed etc. We only got paper plan and audio guide and were left on our own. I had to find the way by myself, luckily got to the right direction, otherwise I would miss some important parts as it took really long time to get to / through the Sistine Chapel.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Czech Republic

data.title: Interesting but really overcrowded!
data.message: It was nice place with very interesting expositions, but was very overcrowded and very hot inside. But after all it is good to go there.
data.author: DIMITAR – Bulgaria

data.title: The booking was easy.
data.message: The guide took us in the directed me to the audio guide counter. She was helpfull.
data.author: Nicola – Italy

data.message: Worth it.
data.author: Carlos – Costa Rica

data.title: Not as advertised, very disappointing, a lot of money for VERY littl
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.message: A unique experience!
data.author: Nuno – United Kingdom

data.title: A total joke, FAR too many people
data.message: Don’t bother with this tour. The queues were enormous and once inside the Vatican there were so many people it was ridiculous and unsafe. It must have been 50degrees Celsius and was utterly unpleasant, could barely stop to see anything as was swept along with 1000’s of people all trying to do the same tour. data.title: Paid big premium to skip a non-existent line
data.message: When we were there (on a Saturday afternoon at 3pm) there was no lineup. Of course we didn't know that, so I'm giving this 2 stars simply because it gave us peace of mind that we wouldn't have to line up. But it would have been better to research when the busy times were and simply avoid them. Expensive premium over the basic entry fee (with audio guide). Absolutely packed with massive groups of people crushing through the galleries. Would not go to this tour again. The sistine chapel was breathtaking, but the entire time in the Vatican Museum and approaching the sistine chapel it was shoulder-to-shoulder with huge tour groups forcing their way through the tiny doorsways and halls like sweaty mindless fat-bergs through a plugged sewer. I'd recommend going in the dead of winter. Or not going at all. Certainly don't pay to skip the line.

data.title: Good entrance option on a busy day
data.message: Arrived at the meetingpoint 10 mins before the entrance time. We had tickets for 2, the group that was escourted was about 10 people. It was a very busy day at the museum and we had to wait 30 minutes in the fast track entry line (while the other endless no ticket line was not moving at all). Therefore, a very good option if you want to get inside on a busy day. Booked the audioguide which was informative and also helpful while moving between the different rooms. While standing in line we also asked about the basilica entrance, the guide said that some days the back right door is open at the Sistine Chapel for direct entrance to the basilica. We were able to spot the door and took the chance to skip the basilica line. Overall a very good experience!

data.title: Very popular large museum of art, statues and exhibitions
data.message: The Vatican museum has a large collection of Egyptian, Greek and Roman exhibitions with the Sistine chapel at the end. While the exhibitions were interesting and impressive it begins to feel like more of the same towards the end and requires a long time to see everything which can be quite draining in a large crowd as it is busy all day. The Sistine chapel was a bit underwhelming but partially when compared to some of the other rooms, my favourite being a long corridor with beautiful maps of every province in Italy with great detail. These are just on the walls amongst other art, statues and the whole corridor looks stunning. The whole thing is a worthwhile experience but don't raise your hopes too high and prepare for a long walk in crowded and hot rooms.

data.title: Ideal for going it alone...no guide
data.message:
During the summer season a fast track entry is essential to the Vatican Museums and the Sistine Chapel. To see all of the rooms in the Vatican Museum requires an entire day's visit, air-cushioned footwear and a stop at the Cafe for a snack and coffee! You can take bottled water in with you. The Sistine Chapel will have you gazing up in wide-eyed wonder at the splendour, colour and detail. It is a lot to take in. No photos or videos allowed. You have to be silent as a respect for the holiness of the chapel. There was chatter from the guided groups who were promptly hushed by the security team in the chapel...hushed via announcement over a loudspeaker.

Tickets for entering St.Peter's Basillica need to be purchased separately. I would recommend that you make the trip to see inside the Basillica first thing in the morning and then tour the museum and chapel afterwards. You won't be disappointed with visiting these sites. Oh...shoulders and knees must be covered for the Sistine Chapel.
data.author: Donna – United Kingdom

data.title: Outstanding
data.message: Beautiful place to visit. Sistine chapel a bit cramped but amazing. Ignore all the touts outside cheaper to do extras at main gate.

data.message: The meeting point was very crowded with other tour groups meeting in the same area. The meeting guides were difficult to find and on introducing ourselves were a little off handed and not very friendly. Other guests seemed to get the same treatment and were often ignored. There 70 in the group and we were then herded to a line to enter the Vatican Museum only to find that it took about 30mins standing in the hot sun to get in. ( Admitedly better than 2 hours). Once in we were directed to the area to pick up our audio device. The museum was extremely crowded, hot and noisy and it was like sheep being herded into a pen as we made our way through the museum. We could not hear our audio, we could not stop to admire any of the items on display and we could not find an escape route out of the museum. The museum attendants did not want to know us. We eventually ended up in the Sistine Chapel which was packed like sardines. We were unable to stop and admire the paintings.Not a good experience

data.title: These tickets will be the best decision of your Vatican Museums visit!
data.message: No question this was our best decision. Skipping a tremendously long line (length influenced by the season and time of day of course, but always there and rumoured at times to be two hours long) to head right indoors? Saving your energy for the crowds inside and allowing yourself the time to view all the treasures inside, not drained from waiting outside? Paying in advance and saving the euros in your pocket for a Prosecco in a piazza? Si, si, si! And you can make the decision there to get the audio guide, but again you can purchase that in advance and 'skip the line' once again.

data.title: Guide was exactly where they said. Right on schedule
data.message: This was the best tour you were on your own. Very nice people it started right on time perfect
data.author: Jessica – United States

data.title: A lot of walking but worth it
data.message: Sistine Chapel is the highlight but also the last thing we came to and in the end people were so anxious to get there that many rooms along the way were ignored from about half way onwards. An amazing collection of art and sculpture-have never seen so much in one place before. Also a good shop at the end. Guidebook rather expensive so I'll be getting mine 2nd hand. Also I realised that my ticket had 11 euros commission which seemed quite a lot on top of standard entrance of 17 euros.
data.author: Mary – United Kingdom

data.title: really fascinating place, stunning fresco's by Michelangelo
data.message: I really enjoyed my time while I was in Vatican museums. You are allowed to take photos for most places but not allowed to take photos even with the mobile phone when you get to the Sistina Chapel. It is prohibited to take photos but many people taken photos anyway and not been fined for that. The thing is that some staff might be very rude if you try to take some photos which was annoying me because they use physical intervention. Apart from that, it is beautiful to see Sistina Chapel.
data.author: Talip – United Kingdom

data.title: Wow!
data.message: What a place to visit! Definitely worth getting the skip the line ticket!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Beautiful sites!
data.message: However, the process of getting in and getting our headsets took almost an hour and their is no AC.
data.author: Kimberley – United States

data.title: Must fast track
data.message: The line was giant! Wrapped around the walls of the Vatican. Highly recommend skip the line, and also purchasing an audioguide once inside.
data.author: April – United Kingdom

data.title: Worth the queue jump and more!
data.message: So glad we booked these tickets; we would have wasted hours in the queue in the morning, and this way we walked straight in to see the most amazing sights! So easy with the app as well.
data.author: Victoria – United Kingdom

data.title: Very easy, quick to get in. Would recommend an early morning start.
data.author: Ian – New Zealand

data.title: Getting in was easy the crowds were horrible
data.message:
The fast track was excellent and made getting in very easy. The crowds inside were horrible. Very pushy people with zero respect for others or the art around them.
Also be prepared to be asked by ticket sales people outside of the museum and in the surrounding areas if you want to buy tickets about 100 times before you make it in. These people are pushy!
data.author: Michelle – United States

data.title: Worth it!
data.message:
We choose the skip the line but without a guide, which was the perfect solution for us, we ended up being there more than 3 hours, going around and just enjoying and exploring instead of the guided tours where people were being rushed through. If you need a guide then take the audio guide option so you can still do it at your own accord.

The place was amazing and beautiful and breathtaking. We have seen so much beauty here in Rome, but this topped it all. Only thing we ever saw that was better was La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona!
data.author: Benjamin – Denmark

data.title: Simple and fast
data.message: The booking was easy. The meeting point was easy to find. The process to get in was easy and was led by the guide. After that we were free to navigate at our own pace. I will recommend!
data.author: Ian – Canada

data.title: Fabulous, fast entrance with no fuss
data.author: Ladeanna – United Kingdom

data.title: Price could be lower considering the service.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – South Korea

data.title: All in all a very expensive visit with very little in return
data.message: We had tickets for the Vatican museum with audioguides on a Thursday mid August at 3 pm. We got in easily but once inside, the museum was so overcrowded (never experienced a crowd like this) and so hot, we couldn’t quite enjoy it. The audioguides were of such poor quality - we gave up using them before reaching the Sixtine Chapel. The (almost) 150 euros for four people we paid felt like a rip off. The Vatican should contingent the number of visitors like the Borghese Museum does so that people can actually enjoy what they see - and there is so much to see!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Germany

data.message: 2 really helpful knowledgeable ladies escorted us in to the Vatican. Thank you!
data.author: Catherine – United Kingdom

data.title: It got us to where we wanted to be very efficiently.
data.author: James – United Kingdom

data.message: Although we didn’t spend much time with the guides, they were extremely nice, efficient and helpful.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Germany

data.message: It's very long and too many people are allowed in at the same time meaning it's hot, rather smelly and almost impossible to take a photo. loved Rome but would never visit the Vatican again
data.author: Anthony – Ireland

data.title: We got quickly through the rows.
data.message: It was just pity that we couldn't change the appointment, because my daughter wasn't an adult, but 16 years. And it's rather expensive, isn't it? But you get what you want: passing the rows!
data.author: Gijsbert – Netherlands

data.title: Very funny and knowledgeable tour guide,thank you.
data.author: Tony – United Kingdom

data.title: Beautiful
data.message: We had a great time and were glad of the skip the queue service on a very busy August day. Thanks
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.message: excellwnt
data.author: Gregori – Greece

data.title: The Vatican Museum is incredible!
data.message: I could only say good things about the Vatican Museum. Getting into the museum with the fast track entry needs a little work. The meeting spot is great - right across from the museum entrance. But it was also the meeting spot for probably 10 other tours when we were supposed to be there. And trying to distinguish between all of the tours (including several from Get Your Guide) was a little confusing, and could've been organized better. Communicating with everyone in the group could've been better as well. No explanations were given about what we were doing, so we just had to go with it and hope we didn't lose the guide who was taking us inside. Other than that, it was great!
data.author: Marlin – United States

data.message: Very easy to find meeting point. There is a build in gps on map to follow but they are literally across the road from the main entrance with a ‘get your guide’ flag. From walking across to the entrance getting in past security (bags go in xray machines) and then handed our tickets it took all but 10mins. VERY easy and highly recommended. The queue outside was pathetic! This was painless and very quick which was a blessing in 32degree heat. Once inside we were free to walk around and look as we opted for the non guided tour. We spent 3.5hrs there. Heads up for both male and females, knees must be covered. So if in shorts you will need to bring or buy a scarf/muslin which are sold outside for €5. Shoulders also need to be covered. This is ONLY FOR THE SISTINE CHAPEL. Which is normally the very last thing you see inside. All in all 10/10 and ***** FIVE stars off me!
data.author: Ian – United Kingdom

data.message: it was very busy as expected but thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
data.author: Anne – Italy

data.message: Overpriced tickets for a very limited service assist.
data.author: Adolfo – United Kingdom

data.message: Really fast entrance compared to the line without tickets! Excellent experience! Quite pleased! I would definitely recommend it!
data.author: Evangelia – Greece

data.title: A little mess to get in
data.message: The experience was a little mess during the get in process. Many people waiting in this street. Previous information was good but after getting inside the museum you realize that there are many things. Besides, they said about the audio guidance but it doesn’t come with ear phones. I thought that was kind overpriced. I was with friends that payed the same amount for other company which picked them up at hotel, besides the audio guidance there was the live audio guidance with a people explaining everything. Much better.
data.author: Caio – Brazil

data.title: Frustrating start but okay
data.message: On arriving to the meeting point- which was literally a person on some steps I was bombarded with street sellers trying to sell me a scarf to cover my shoulder to go in the Sistine chapel. It was 32 degrees so I was wearing a strapping dress. I was so frustrated by the constant bombardment I never brought one and couldnt go in the chapel. Once inside the boards of ripple was over whelming and took a lot of the enjoyment out of it all. Actual ticket and entrance was easy enough but just be prepared for mass sheep herding and street sellers and aggressive street sellers. The annoying thing was the woman who was sorting the tickets and taking us into the chapel never even said anything! I went all that way and never even got in!!!!
data.author: Lindsey – United Kingdom

data.title: Great and really easy.
data.message: Easy way in and it saved a lot of time. Audioguide was great becaus you could go by yourself and explore things with no rush.
data.author: Noora – Finland

data.title: So easy to use and it beat the queue's
data.message: Very easy service to use. OK it cost a few Euro's on the price of the ticket but we went to the Vatican and no queuing. Guide was so easy to find and had our tickets waiting for us. Would recommend and use again.
data.author: Michael – United Kingdom

data.title: We loved our experience in Rome, the guide got us into Vatican.
data.message: We didn't have to wait outside in the sun while other people were. Past all of them and got in the Vatican without waiting. The guide wasn't to be found after we entered into the Vatican. Didn't matter to us though.
data.author: Gregory – United States

data.title: Had to meet outside in rain, then moved inside as a big group
data.author: Colin – United Kingdom

data.title: Convenient meeting point, fast efficient entry
data.message: We went the day prior to locate the meeting point outside the Vatican. It’s across the street right in front of the Vatican entrance. Convenient meeting area. Our meeting time was 9:45 with 10 am entrance. Without the fast track entrance - lines were astronomically long wrapped around the Vatican wall at that time of the morning and it only gets worse throughout the day. We were escorted inside through security, given our tickets and collected audio guides (if applicable) and then free visit the museum. Vatican is MASSIVE. There’s so much to see there!! A lot of walking and standing. Wear comfortable shoes. Women should have their shoulders and knees covered in respect for what the religious site tries to represent. If you forget - there are tons of vendors strategically located to sell you a scarf to cover up. Using this service helped take any uncertainty out of exactly where to go / what to do once inside ticket area of Vatican bc they did it all for you.
data.author: Connie – United States

data.title: Met guide easily and got in pretty much straight away.
data.author: Claire – United Kingdom

data.title: It was nice to gain entry quickly and easily to the Sistine Chapel.
data.author: Ingrid – United States

data.title: It was a complete utter waste of money
data.message: We were very dissatisfied with the complete experience. We were not allowed entry into the sistene chapel. They told us it was closed with no explanation as to why. No one knew from our tickets where we needed to enter any building. It was a complete disaster and waste of my monies. I would never recommend this excursion to anyone. We were very disappointed as we couldn’t enter anywhere.
data.author: Bonnie – United States

data.title: Great way to get into Vatican City.
data.author: Sheila – United States

data.title: Very rude and didn’t give us any assistance once in the museum
data.message: Very rude and offered no guide
data.author: sara – United Kingdom

data.title: You skip the line to enter! But the museum is really crowded.
data.author: Arthur – United States

data.title: Like a hot version of IKEA
data.message: Terrible place to be on a hot August day, if you like being pushed and shoved in a never ending line of people this is the place to go, and so many people buying skip the line tickets that you need a skip the line to the skip the line Q to get in! They should just sell admission to the Sistine chapel which in truth is what 99% of people come to see anyways
data.author: Keith – United Kingdom

data.message: The staff was amazing! We were a few mins late and they worked Their magic to get us in! Walked in within 5mins!
data.author: Monique – United States

data.title: One of the most stunning things I have seen in my life.
data.message: I was walking around in awe throughout the whole tour. The Vatican museums or "rooms" are a MUST SEE if you are planning to visit Rome. No matter what your religion is, or how passionate you are about art, you will definitely be blown away by the magnificence of the artworks you will see exposed in the rooms. It takes quite a while to walk through all the rooms if you wanna have a proper look. I would say around 3/4 hours since we are talking about approximately... 7 km of rooms! But it's definitely worth your time and money. Can't wait to go back to Rome to visit the Vatican Museums again. PS: The audioguide is pretty good. Concise and informative. I recommend it for those who want to know what they're looking at.
data.author: Celeste – United Kingdom

data.title: Too many people
data.message:
Well organised but too many people and lots of pushing and shoving (not the tour operators fault)
Yes it’s high season but messy inside and hot (not tour operators fault)
data.author: Gary – New Zealand

data.title: An original “wonder of the world “
data.message: Enough said !
data.author: Larry – Panama

data.title: Great Experience
data.message:
This tour is well worth the money. Skip the line is perfect..you go in with the guide and don't have to make that long line that everybody is in..you go thru the museum..you have to do security check in like an airport security...women make sure your shoulders are covered or else they won't let you in & you have to rent a scarf to cover your shoulders and also your shorts.
The Sistine Chapel is BEAUTIFUL!!!
data.author: Perla – United States

data.message: Not sure if we were expedited at the time we went the line moving inside was not very long. We met the guide the directions how to get to the meeting point was not very clear. We were rushing to get to the location on time after spending a great deal of time trying to locate the guide at the meeting location. Instead of giving us street address, they should have also included the meeting point is directly in front of the Museum entrance across the street on the stairs. Everyone know who the Get your guide agents were and their locations...we were bombarded by agents to try and get us to buy their expedited services.
data.author: Gregory – United States

data.message: It's just a fast track ticket, even then the "guides" were pretty rude about answering basic questions
data.author: Wen Li – Malaysia

data.title: Poor
data.message: The staff are rude and not very helpful
data.author: Maridel – United Kingdom

data.message: guide went ahead and lost back of group, had to pay entry fee again
data.author: Oliver – United Kingdom

data.title: Fairly Straight Forward
data.message: Met the guides on the stairs across from the entrance on the hill. Easy to spot, and straight forward as we cut through the entrance. Did our own tour following Rick Steves podcast, all worked out well!
data.author: Evann – United States

data.message: It is not fast track
data.author: Andrei – Netherlands

data.message: it was very good experience, fast pass tickets very very quikle unbelievable
data.author: Ilan – Israel

data.title: Everything went well, we had a fantastic tour!
data.author: Gabor – Hungary

data.title: Crowded, hot, underwhelming
data.message: The Vatican tour was quite stressful. After being just a few minutes late, we were prompted to reschedule which was annoying but entirely our fault although it was hard to navigate as we had never travelled to Rome before. The constant bombardment of people on the street asking us if we need help finding the Vatican was extremely annoying. And inside it was insanely crowded and HOT. So unbareable in the summer. With all the money coming in from revenue I think investing in some air conditioning would help the experience be palatable. The museum was underwhelming and the only real gem was the Sistine Chapel (which was thankfully air conditioned). The dress code was not enforced during my trip so the scarf I had purchased to cover up was a waste of money. Honestly the entire experience was underwhelming and annoying. There was also no way to see the Vatican itself which in my opinion, is the whole reason people come to tour. Unorganised, messy, and crowded experience.
data.author: Julia – United Kingdom

data.message: Not very good
data.author: Benita – United States

data.title: Thanks fast line not so fast
data.message: Guided tour people came by and suggested for extra money to skip the long fast line
data.author: Silia – Cyprus

data.title: booked for vatican museum and sistine chapel
data.message: good experience..we are able to get in quick and easy.our tour guide has good english.my 13 yr old son enjoyed it.its worth the money
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Ireland

data.message: Take some water with you ifbyoubplan to go on summer. it's quite hot inside the museum and no drinkable water unless you want to buy some from the cafeteria after waiting in a big line
data.author: Zhao – China

data.title: Convenient but expensive and chaotic.
data.message:
The two guides were stressed out and gave a poor impression at the meetup point.

As we got inside, although relatively quick, they were arguing amongst themselves. Not very professional.

One of the guides were wearing shorts that showed all of her thighs, not att all professional in this tour.

We got in quick and payed a large sum for it. Was it worth it? We were in a rush so yes. Did we get the professional responce for such a high price? Definately not!

The tour inside was interesting with the audio guide and remember to bring your own 3.5mm headphones. It was a lot longer than we had thought and took almost all day in the heat, no aircon what so ever.

The food and service inside was bad and pricy.
data.author: Joakim – Sweden

data.title: Quick, Easy, exactly what we needed
data.author: Chris – Australia

data.title: Great service
data.message: Katja and Francesca were amazing! Go get yout guide!
data.author: Jos – Belgium

data.title: Saved the long que paying some premium.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – South Korea

data.title: Straight in, no problems.
data.message: Fast track entry worked extremely well. Still had to queue at security, but everyone has to do that.
data.author: Eleanor – United Kingdom

data.title: Easy access but it was too crowded season
data.author: Anne – Finland

data.title: We were late, but the staff were very accommodating to rebook our visi
data.message: We were late for few minutes but the staff accommodate us quickly for another time slot.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Switzerland

data.title: A bit chaotic ,no explanation before entering of procedure once inside
data.author: Andrew – United Kingdom

data.title: Entrance group too large....
data.message: We couldn’t hear instructions and guide wouldn’t repeat herself. Entrance to museum and Sistine chapel was speedy though.
data.author: Sarah – United Kingdom

data.title: Was upsold by guide on street and told we needed a ticket to St. Peter
data.message: Terrible rude guide, little information, faulty equipment , told we could renter to see museum and couldn’t . And street sakesman was just a con . Really felt taken advantage of....
data.author: William – United States

data.title: Very easy and comfortable to access in Vatican museum without waiting
data.message: Very easy, comfortable to enter in Vatican Museum and staffs were very kind and available for any question.
data.author: Jae yun – Italy

data.title: Overall good, but for apx 100$ it felt like we were on our own
data.message:
Regarding the GYG experience, the girls at the meeting point seemed a little inexperienced as we had to insist on showing them our voucher in order to be included in the group. It felt like anyone with a GYG sticker (or without one) could just stay near the group and skip the line with us.

As a remark to all tourists who visit the Museums for the fist time, the Sixteenth Chapel is also a museum and DOES NOT REQUIRE an additional ticket as the title and description of this Activity might suggest. Once entered, you can do pretty much whatever circuit you want, this service you are booking ends after you pass the security check.

We booked 2 audio guides, but just one would have been enough for 2 as it has 2 headset outputs. Bring your headsets!!!

Overall, we entered the museums very fast (5 min or less). The queue was very long (at least 1h) and the weather was very hot. Price of a normal ticket is 17€, so you decide if it is worth it.
data.author: Razvan – Romania

data.message: it was good to skip the line at St Peter's. it was worth the cost. but the meeting place was not well marked. i had to ask for help before i found the right place. it needs to be explained better.
data.author: David – United States

data.title: The jump the que aspect qorked very well we walked straight in
data.message: a must see attraction when you are in Rome
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Denmark

data.title: Awesome
data.message: Perfect

data.message: Quick entry, all in all must of taken 10 minutes and this seemed quick for the amount of people in the main foyer, little waiting time. Note the audio guide does not come with headphones

data.message: Simply fantastic... Architecture is unbelievable
data.author: Mark – United Kingdom

data.title: Amazing
data.message:
Fun filled experience. Bettered our trip to Rome and made us feel like we were experiencing a true Italian journey.

Thank you so much

data.message: Its not fast track
data.author: Sebastian – United States

data.title: Decent alternative for cutting in lines
data.message: A smooth and simple way to avoid queuing for the Vatican Museums (inkl Sistine Chapel). A guide escorts you and rest of the participants through the group entrance. Very little information in general, and basically no tips (if you don't ask) of how to maximize your visit once inside the Vatican. Quite priceworthy, considering the time-saving impact, but a higher grade would require more additional guidance about the procedure and the visit as such.
data.author: André – Sweden

data.title: Good organized.
data.message: Good experience overall, but too expensive taking into account the included services.

data.title: Our time there was wonderful! And we don't have to wait much
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Greece

data.title: primary school information, lot of repetition
data.message: the guide was not knowledgeable or she did not share her knowledge. Tour was clearly simed for us persons without eu history information. Skip the line was useful, but guide was waste of. money
data.author: Anita – Netherlands

data.title: Entrance is not clearly marked...make detail map for finding entrance
data.author: Ivan – Serbia

data.title: Beautiful combination of art and religion
data.message: Do get the fast track/skip the line tickets, as the queue was quite long. Saved a lot of time
data.author: Michelle – Italy

data.title: Not worth the money or the hanging about in the heat
data.message: The girls who worked there were pleasant enough, but we hung about in the heat for some unknown reason to then be escorted to a door into the Vatican museum, where to be honest any unscrupulous person could have tagged along and snuck in through the skip the line door. No security checks, no name checks. If we weren’t honest we could have done the whole trip for nothing

data.title: Good but unnecessary since there was no line to enter the museum.

data.title: Rip-off...audio guide is not worth the money

data.message: Definitely worth pre booking in the summer to avoid the ques

data.title: No queuing efficient and super museum

data.title: Actually lets you skip the line!
data.message: This was v well organised. We met the guide across the street and they walked us in allowing us to skip the queue. Once through security we were given our individual tickets and allowed to explore the museums ourselves - absolutely ideal. We were on our way into the museum by 10.15!!!

data.message: On the day we went to the Vatican city the main church was closed on a Tuesday at midday as the Pope was going to take a service later that day so did not get to see inside. Very disappointed

data.message: I wish there was an additional option to visit the St. Peter's Basilica as well in the fast track entry.

data.message: A very busy time of year and extremely hot. I would suggest doing this in the cooler months. Get Your Guide was very helpful though and we got inside nice and quickly.

data.message: a bit slow.....

data.title: Very good but very crouded
data.message: Long lines, poor info on which line to get into. massive folks packed into the sistene chapel many confusing lines to get what you need to see these magnificent treasures.
data.author: Claude – United States

data.title: Beautiful to see glad we booked fast track. Do easy.
data.message: Will be recommending to family coming next month.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.message: Having in mind that the cost of the entrance ticket was only €17 I thlink that the amount of €146 is too high.
data.author: Μaria – Cyprus

data.title: The line was faster but the museum was great.
data.message: There needs to be a better way to find the meeting point. For tourist who are not good at finding their way around and unfamiliar city it can be taxing and stressful.
data.author: Wendell – United States

data.title: An excellent way to see a popular venue.
data.message: Everything was made very clear from the details about the meeting-point up to the time we were admitted to the Vatican Museum. There were plenty of guides to deal with everyone's questions and they gave good advice about the visit.
data.author: Guy – United Kingdom

data.title: An interesting but long tour.
data.message: Worth every pennt but the tour is long amd crowded. We tried to be a bit fast but still used 2 hrs. The tour itself was amazing!

data.title: The audio and map wasn’t very good
data.author: Melanie – United Kingdom

data.title: I thought some of recordings took a while to get to the point.
data.message: Was not clear if we had to stay with the group. Had to use restroom and lost the group. Not sure it made any difference. With the long recordings and really big crowds it was hard to stay in one place.
data.author: Karl – Italy

data.title: Lack of info
data.message: No audiotour / “ official vatican” ppl bother and scare people that their ticket is no good and that they cant enter saint peters with it!!!! Almost bought a 21€ extra ticket to visit a basilica!!! when its free, these indians at the door where scaring people telling them they would have to walk 8km back and do a 2 h line cos they had only museums and chapel access!! Its my third time there and i just walked in the basilica no problem, we were four!! Be careful
data.author: agustina – Italy

data.title: Would like a refund
data.message: Post security check the tour group left without us. No effort in helping/finding us. No headset and no guide. Tried searching for group for 30 mins but no luck. Would like a refund.

data.title: well organized
data.message: the guide was a bit delayed and would be great to receive some information from the hostesses on the spot
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Czech Republic

data.title: Beautiful
data.message: Thanks to the skip the line ticket, no waiting time
data.author: Karina – Belgium

data.title: Very good
data.message: Very well organized.

data.title: PLEASE INFORM PPL THAT U CANT GO BACK 2 MUSEUM AFTER SISTINE CHAPEL
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Italy

data.title: Glad we bought this.
data.message: So many touts trying to get us to upgrade for an adfitional cost. do not do it... stick with your get your guide voucher.. then get your tickets once inside. Very busy so buy get your beat the line before you travel.
data.author: Gail – United Kingdom

data.message: We had an audio tour and the staff was very helpful from the meeting point to the museum. The only problem was that our tickets were for 3pm entrance and the whole museum and the chapel is closed at 5.30 but the staff didn’t inform us about the hours. They should be much more informative if it’s an audio guide tour or else.
data.author: Recep – Turkey

data.title: Simple
data.message: Just great
data.author: Alexandria – United Kingdom

data.title: Not really needed
data.message:
We had to queue again to get the proper tickets. The museum is not accessible with the online booking.

Would have been better to have it combined with St Peter’s. Very long queue there.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – France

data.title: Beautiful Artifacts and treasures
data.message: The walk was very long with quite a few stairs and very little to sit and rest but that aside was enchanting the feeling of history surrounded you wherever you looked.
data.author: anthony – United Kingdom

data.title: Beautiful Buildings
data.message:
1. You need some sort of tour. Nothing is labeled like a normal museum so unless you have a guide you won’t know what anything is. Also there isn’t a set/easy path to follow. There’s random hallways and you will end up walking in circles if you don’t have a guide.

2. I got here via a Hop on Hop off bus. I had to walk over 30 minutes just to get to the entrance to the Vatican. Recommend you research more carefully then I did how to get to the entrance to the vatican.

3. You can’t talk, take pictures, wear a hat, or have exposed shoulders in the Sistine Chapel. PLEASE respect that. Loud guests and people who took their shawls off/took pictures after coming into the chapel caused a lot of commotion with security having to speak on a loud speaker and ruined the experience of a quiet place to respect the art/history.
data.author: Melissa – United States

data.title: Good
data.message: Good, efficient, well organised but a little pricey compared to self organised but then ultimately you get what you pay for. Thanks!
data.author: sofian – United Kingdom

data.title: As described. On time and well organised
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Australia

data.message: Guide was good in verbal and explain nicely each and every part of Sistine Chappel
