data.message: the fast track and the process with get my guide is smooth but the musuem is soooo crowded and the audio guude is not well done in my opinion. i dont feel like a learnt a lot and i was more frustrated
data.author: Yasmine – Belgium

data.title: Amazing
data.message: Skipped the line, very useful
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Canada

data.message: I wouldn’t recommend this tour. This ticket is only to skip the line.
data.author: Marina – San Rafael, United States

data.message: A little more details about where to start walking will be nice. Other than that the were very friendly
data.author: Karla – United States

data.title: This was amazing, a must when in Rome!
data.author: Runar – Norway

data.message: Way too many people to be able to have a relaxing time enjoying the exhibits
data.author: John – United Kingdom

data.title: Amazing
data.message: Crowded
data.author: Arlene – United States

data.title: Waited in line an hour and 15 minutes!! Horrible!
data.message: This is BY NO MEANS a "fast track" into the museum. Stood in line for I-1/4 hours then just handed tickets for museum. That's it. Besides the 17 Euro for the tickets, what did I pay for?? Will NEVER do this again. I do not recommend. Too many "fast track" tour groups operating.
data.author: Denise – United States

data.title: Hastle free and peace of mind.
data.message: Booked on the spur of the moment. Reasonable price. On completion of transaction asked to download app which was very helpful as I received a reminder in the morning along with a map to navigate to rendezvous point and vouchers online. Took snapshot of vouchers as was not sure on WiFi reception and breazed through everything like a cop with a badge.
data.author: Ranbir – United Kingdom

data.title: Amazing collection of artifacts. Could spend days viewing.
data.author: Mark – United Kingdom

data.title: Good guide
data.message: The payment for a guide is essential when you see the long lines outside these venues. The guide helps you navigate the mess to make the experience much more rewarding.
data.author: Alejandro – United States

data.title: Not worth paying 2x the ticket price.
data.message:
Disorganised chaos.
You are better off doing this alone; it costs €17 and you can get through much quicker. For the 'fast track' you're paying an extra €20, to then be held up by everyone else. Wouldn't bother in future.
data.author: Liam – United Kingdom

data.title: Terrible!
data.message:
The description of the meeting place was not clear enough so we weren’t able to be find out where to go to be there 15 minutes early as we had planned.
When we finally found out where to go, there were so many people meeting at the same place and it was very hard to find our guide.
We arrived just before 10 am and then we saw someone in a green shirt (as mentioned) walking towards the stairs to go to the Colosseum, so she left before 10.
We had to run after her since she was walking very fast with no indication of the name of the company.ALL VERY CONFUSING!!!! She should have had a flag or something like the other companies.
When we finally found out that we were at the right place we could barely keep up with our guide. She started walking away from the Colosseum and had to stop at a ticket booth and then started walking towards the Roman Forum without mentioning anything to us why we weren’t going to the Colosseum. We ended up getting in really far from the Colosseum with kids...
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Canada

data.title: Excellent option for visiting the Vatican Museums
data.message:
I booked 2 ticket for the Vatican Museums, and due the traffic we arrived late but the staff were super kind and understandable and let us in in the next group.
I would definitely use again the services of Getyourguide
data.author: Francisco Javier – Spain

data.message: The museum was a great experience but the only thing which bothered me a bit was that we booked the time slot for 3pm but only started the tour at 3:45pm due to the Audioguide lines. I thought that it could of been a bit more organized. Due to the late start we had to try and rush through the whole museum to try and see everything because the museum closed at 5:30pm. Other than that I thought the museum was lovely and you get to see a lot of amazing things.
data.author: Jonas – Germany

data.message: Great attention to service and customer needs. We were late to our appointment and our guide put in the effort to try to find spots for us to attend the next session. Getting the audio guides and meeting at the meetup point to receive the tickets was also easy. Thank you for making our visit to the Vatican Museum effortless and enjoyable!
data.author: Julie – United States

data.message: Definitely the best way to go about booking for the vatican. No queues, fairly priced and the guides were extremely helpful and polite. The audio was great to have also! 10/10 rating.
data.author: Ciara – Ireland

data.message: We arrived earlier than our schedule and were invited to join the previous group. It was easy to locate the GYG team. The wait time to join the museum was a bit execessive (1 hour).
data.author: Daniel – Portugal

data.title: Fast tracked, very pleasant. But no ear phones like other companies.
data.author: Theofilos – United Kingdom

data.title: Would have been quicker to get their early and queue up in normal line
data.author: Jessica – Australia

data.message: this is not a real skip the line. I had to wait 30 minutes before I could go in.
data.author: Philippe – Switzerland

data.message: ‘Fast track’ had a 90 min line to get into the Vatican. Completely misrepresented. Also cost was considerably higher than the actual tickets to get in. Terrible experience. Would not recommend.
data.author: Brian – United States

data.message: waited nearly 2hrs for skip the queue, should not of bothered.
data.author: Thomas – United Kingdom

data.title: Well organized tour without waiting in line!
data.message:
One of the best skip the line tour in Europe without waiting in line.
Staff were courteous, and website provided easy to follow instructions prior to the tour. I would definitely recommend it to friends and book again in the future.
Vatican Museum & Sistine Chapel WOW!!!!!!
data.author: Candy – United States

data.title: It was a great experience to go through the museums.
data.message: The tour was exactly as advertised! It was a lovely experience.
data.author: Rahul – Canada

data.message: Meeting point no easy to find it
data.author: stephane – Italy

data.title: Finding meetup location was diificult if you don’t know Rome
data.author: Lorie – United States

data.title: Unorganised chaos
data.message: Given a location to meet the get your guide reps. After we had found where they should be, they didn’t exactly let themselves be known. Eventually we picked them out and that’s when they said we can go straight in. So why am I meeting you if I can go in? Not only that but I’m being bombarded by men trying to force there expensive scarfs on my girlfriend to enter the chapel (don’t buy these, mega expensive) let’s just say they learnt a few colourful English words! I then proceed in and get to the till. When the gentlemen proceeds to ask for identification (something not mentioned by get your guide) I simply said I don’t have any and we were told we can’t have our tickets. Luckily for me my girlfriend kept her cool and managed to convince the guy I could use Facebook as my id. He reluctantly used it and then was extremely rude about it. The museum itself and the chapel were both fantastic to see but you 100% need a guided tour. Just not ‘get your guide’ who are less than helpful
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: The sign the guide holds should be more visible [ taller ]
data.author: Paula – United Kingdom

data.message: Excellent..thank you Maria
data.author: RABIA – Turkey

data.title: Super Fast Track
data.message:
Although this deal seemed expensive at the time. It was a no brainer!!
As we walked to St Peters and the Vatican, tour guides stopped us but actually helped us, by directing us where we needed to go and even pointed out our reps at the meeting point. The reps were helpful and gave us information what was going to happen. We skipped the line and walked in through the security check where they gave us our tickets and told us how to get our audio guides (we could have bought them ourselves slightly cheaper at the entrance but again there was no queue, so it's upto you). The audio guide gave you more information as you keyed in the number relevant to the room or artifact to listen to, which was very informative.
data.author: Veronica – United Kingdom

data.message: 1-hour queueing even with "fast track" option. Assistance was ok, but I would recommend not to go for a visit the day before or after a public holiday. Too crowded and you cannot even enjoy the tour
data.author: Deborah – Italy

data.title: Would have been better as a guided tour
data.message: Without the audio guide if was a bit like getting herded through an IKEA store with a long way to get to the sistine Chapel. The opulence is staggering and if you love art it is a must
data.author: Bryan – Canada

data.title: Very nice
data.message: Very quick and nice experience
data.author: Ling-wen – Taiwan

data.message: Make sure to book your ticket ahead of visiting or you may ne in line for hours. Get your guide walked us straight through without a wait.
data.author: Valerie – United States

data.title: Helpful but has points to improve
data.message:
It’s really helpful that it saved a lot of time for us. However, some staff has the tendency to be a bit impatient or somewhat rude to Asian tourists. I just felt it. Sorry.

It will be helpful also to inform customers that you dont provide earphones or headsets for the audio device you rent out. Good thing i have one in my bag so i was able to use it. I saw some who dont have and just place the device near their ears which is very inconvenient.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Singapore

data.title: First class
data.message: Seem less entry to venue.
data.author: John – United Kingdom

data.title: Never found the rep
data.message: Couldn’t find the rep at stated location so went in ourselves.
data.author: John – United Kingdom

data.title: Ok
data.message: Ok
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Denmark

data.message: At the Vatican you are treated as cattle. The crowd is huge and you barely have a chance to walk without being pushed. By the other hand, GET YOUR GUIDE service was great!!
data.author: JUAN PABLO – Colombia

data.title: Thank you!! I’m very happy for the service.
data.author: Buncha – Finland

data.title: Very clear booking. Excellent guides who got us in quickly.
data.author: Mohsin – United Kingdom

data.title: Short wait to get into awesome museum
data.message: It was a relatively short wait to get into the Museum and Chapel. We were able to get audio tour devices pretty quickly as well. We appreciated not having to wait on long lines outside. There was a bit of a wait inside but not too long.
data.author: Deborah – United States

data.title: No tour guides came to meet us at 8:00pm
data.message: I was waiting for over 40 min ,Call the company ,no one came to meet us or give us the tour we try to call it wants to voice recoding company never called me back I will dispute the charges also sent an email it comes back as wrong mail address it 0 star
data.author: michel – United States

data.message: great tour with 6the time and cost
data.author: Josr – United States

data.title: Exact on time, professional service.
data.message: Excellent service.
data.author: Bezzina – Malta

data.title: Closes at 6, cover knees and shoulders
data.message: The purchase was easy and so was using tickets to Vatican. Did nothing for chapel. I was a bit bothered that we prepared by covering shoulder but was not aware front and back of knees also needed to be covered. There are tons of vendors outside selling wraps for 5+ euro. The issue I had is that the tour guide did state they were cheaper to buy outside than inside, which is the truth. The part that mostly bothered me was that the Vatican would provide you with a paper mesh material to cover both shoulders and knees at no cost. Also, we bought wraps on outside, and when we were walking though, we saw plenty of females with exposed knees.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: Fantastic service. Easy to locate the group, definitely worth it.
data.author: Janet – United Kingdom

data.message: well organised ,meeting point easy to find as well as the staff .
data.author: julie – United States

data.message:
Wasn’t expecting a tour guides queue
We didn’t skip the line , we joined one albeit not the big one
Tickets for 10am , didn’t get entry until 10:45
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: The entrance was fast
data.message: The problem is there is too many people inside and it is difficult to see the museums
data.author: oliva – Mexico

data.message: it is just a skip the line with ticket. no tour
data.author: Renato – Belgium

data.title: Great works of art. Very crowded.
data.message: There wasn't that much organization once they led us to the building. I know it was unguided but they could've done more than help us cross the street.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Spain

data.title: Outstanding!
data.message: We went on Friday evening at 7.30. Perfect tone as we have children and it was much cooler for them. Get the different audio guides for kids and adults as they were full of information. Everything went perfect. Only thing we missed was St. Peter’s bassilica but there’s always next time. Get your guide was a perfect way to go. No hassle straight through. Would highly recommend.
data.author: Michelle – Ireland

data.title: Very easy and smooth entry.
data.message: Buying the tickets online was easy. The guides were there when we arrived. Our names were on their list. They explained everything pretty well. Smooth entry into the chappel.
data.author: Hicran – Turkey

data.message: The fast track was a bit of a joke. It took us 40 minutes to get in!
data.author: Hamish – Saudi Arabia

data.message: well worth it...better spend all day in the museum instead of all day in line
data.author: Travis – Germany

data.title: Fast track entry was brilliant saved hours of waiting in the heat
data.author: Lesley – United Kingdom

data.title: Too many people allowed in at one time, overcrowded thus making it hot
data.author: Jessica – United Kingdom

data.message: Escorted through till receive audio guides and then can explore at your own pace.
data.author: Barkha – Australia

data.message: fastest way to get in there and definitely something to see in Italy!
data.author: Kelsey – Canada

data.title: It was amazing!!!
data.message: What a treasure!
data.author: Andrea J – United States

data.title: Not really a big advantage at the time we visited
data.author: Dan – United Kingdom

data.title: Good one
data.message: No problem with the service, but the original ticket cost just €17. We paid almost twice that price not a problem but could be cheaper. The museum by itself was overloaded with tourists probably it’s better to choose first time slot at the morning
data.author: Alexander – Russia

data.title: Not sure that it was worth twice the normal entry price, but enjoyed
data.author: Kate – Australia

data.message: The guide was exceptional! I arrived 5 minutes late and the guide,'Maria Laura', stopped what she was doing straight away and even though the group was gone inside. She took it upon herself to help me
data.author: Niall – Ireland

data.message: easy to book and friendly staff
data.author: Arun – Italy

data.message: Great, I was able to get in with minimal waiting, however the museum itself gets really really crowded during peak hours, so it makes the experience less enjoyable. Try to get the early morning / off peak hours if you want to avoid that!
data.author: Natalie – Hong Kong

data.title: Great Tour!
data.message:
It was fantastic. The guide was so knowledgable and engaged. The colosseum is such an interesting place, and was really brought to life with the additional information the guide shared on Rome's political, religious and social structure. Couldn't recommend this more! In addition, we were brought right to a special entrance and had very little to no waiting time to get in. It's worth it just to cut the line!

The only slight drawback was that we started 15 minutes late, which for a busy booked day of tours is frustrating. In addition we got there 20 minutes early, as it said to do, and had to wait for a while. Also, it's very hot and not many breaks so be prepared for a tiring few hours.
data.author: Naomi

data.message: sistine chapel is the best
data.author: Sandra – Spain

data.title: Punctual and amazing! NO LINES at all! Smooth entrance!
data.author: Guilherme – United States

data.message: Fantastic! There is truly the origin and the center of modern art!
data.author: Csaba – Romania

data.title: easy, fast way to explore the Vatican museums and Sistine Chapel.
data.author: SIMONE – United Kingdom

data.title: Professionelle
data.message: Without any problem and I saved a lot of time - thank You very much
data.author: Agnieszka – Poland

data.title: They didn't tell you you have to queu again for the Basilica!
data.message: It's only skip the line for the Vatican Museum, not the Basilica!
data.author: Adriana – South Africa

data.message: Walked straight in with the guide, no waiting around at all. Sistine chapel was amazing + we took the right hand door at the bottom of the chapel to St Peter's
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Herded like cattle
data.message: Once inside everyone was herded like cattle through the museum, obvious everyone wanted to just see the Sistine Chapel. And that was quite a disappointment- Creation of Adam much smaller than expected.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: Excellent
data.message: The Guide explained everything. Meeting point on time no problems would book again
data.author: Tony – United Kingdom

data.title: The Door on the Right
data.message: Great visit, fast entry with tickets supplied saved queuing up, lovely place, when leaving the Cistine Chapel go through the door on the right, straight into Basillica.
data.author: Jon – United Kingdom

data.title: Good but so crowded
data.message:
The vatican was one of the main place i wanted to visit in rome. It was really good and i was really impressed by the architecture and the paintings but also impressed by the numbers of tourists inside it. Very hot and hard to breathe sometimes. My boyfriend who is claustrophobic couldnt stay inside
For too long. Be prepared for the crowd then. Must do and see I dont regret it. Faster entrance with the tickets compared to other people who waited 3 hours outside.
data.author: Laura – France

data.title: Incredible, I had no idea there was so much to see.
data.message: This was so much better than I had thought it would be. I probably hadn’t factored in enough time but I think there would never be enough time to see everything. Amazing.
data.author: Suzanne – United Kingdom

data.title: Does what it says on the tin but for a price
data.message: The fast track entry was pretty effortless. Collect your "sticker" from the guide, pass through security, and receive your ticket. No queuing at all (well, except for a few seconds t the security scanner). However. this is significantly more expensive than the standard tickets, so make sure you check if there's a queue first. You can then buy on the app at the last minute.
data.author: Chris – United Kingdom

data.title: Excellent costumer service
data.message: We were late to our tour and didn’t make it before our group left. When we arrived, your guide Giulia, was extremely helpful and called your costumer service auto rebook is for a later your, with and added audio guide that we had to pay the difference for, which was very acceptable and affordable. We were very pleased and happy with the solution she was able to come up with and had an amazing visit to the Vatican City.
data.author: Jon – Denmark

data.title: It was beautifully crowded
data.message: The Vatican is incredible and incredibly crowded... it’s worth the extra patience it takes.
data.author: Casey – United States

data.title: Reassurance of fast entry
data.message: A little difficult to spot the guides (not holding up a sign) but pretty straight forward form there. Guides happy and honest with answers. Worked well.
data.author: Rosanne – Germany

data.title: Great people, great tour, phenomenal experience
data.author: Jack – United Kingdom

data.title: Good organization
data.message:
Good organization
Good english speach
Easy to find meeting point
data.author: Tomas – Czech Republic

data.title: Quick entry on a very hot day!
data.message: Exactly what I purchased!
data.author: Theresa – Canada

data.title: The skip-the-line line was just as long
data.author: Etienne – South Africa

data.title: guide getting us in to and release us, we confused what we should do!!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer

data.title: Poor guide! And Spoiled my whole Vatican experience
data.message: Arrived early, given a orange sticker and she continued to check Others, 7:30pm she stood at stairs said something and walked off. We quickly followed, lined for security in different lines, we came through and said to each other, “that must be our guided enterance” went up the stairs and were rufused entry, entrance gate guy, tour guide desk and reception said they can’t help as it’s a third party. We were left wondering what went wrong when the guy from the guided tour desk came over and said he believes that the guide would still be here in foyer and helped us track her down. When we approached her (30mins later) she said she’s sorry we were late but that’s our fault, I explained that we were early and she should of taken the time to explain what would happen next while we were standing in front of her checking in rather than say something st too if stairs and walk off. First time in Europe and found her disgustingly rude and insulting. Will give further poor review and never use a
data.author: Damien

data.title: Waiting 90 mts is not "dodging the lines"
data.message: I paid a lot of money to wait as long as we did in the 90 degree heat. my kids ran out of patience. once we were in, it was extremely crowded, as it was a busy day, but that was not under the company's control.
data.author: travis – United States

data.message: Fast track wasn't fast, we queued for 40 minutes before we got in, but once we got in the museum and Sistine chapel was great, we had audio headset but would recommend a guide instead
data.author: Mark – United Kingdom

data.title: Good
data.message: Lovely but would go earlier in day as it’s to packed with people !!
data.author: victoria – United Kingdom

data.title: Too many people in the museum at once. Very unsafe!!
data.message: The Vatican should not take so many people in at once. It is really unsafe and there is no learning experience taking place when you can’t even see anything. It is like a stampede. Just a big waste of money. Also too many people in the get your guide group. It was mentioned that only 25 peeple allowed at once per grouo but we were almost 50. If the guides stick to their allocated numbers it would already be much more open and people can actually see something and learn something from the experience. Really a bad experience for our family. My kids ( both 13) didnt learn anything from it and just wanted to get out of there and they said it felt like a soccermatch where thousands of people were trying to get out of a stadium. Not a great way to describe the most holy place and something that we have wanted to see for so many years. Very dissapointing!!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – South Africa

data.title: Difficult to find
data.message: Once found good service
data.author: Arthur – United Kingdom

data.title: The only way to do it. I can't believe people wait in line for hours!
data.message: Super simple - for a small fee we got to skip the line at the Vatican Museum. We walked right in. It's a must do.
data.author: Lourdes – United States

data.title: Great to be able to jump ahead in line!
data.author: Elena – United States

data.title: Seriously Overcrowded.
data.message: We waited one hour 15 minutes to skip the queue. Once inside we had no choice but to walk along or be pushed along like sardines. The cistern chapel was filled with officials shouting silence move along. Most people left quickly through the emergency exit immediately after the ghastly experience.
data.author: Warren – New Zealand

data.title: Great historic paintings and sculptures. Must see
data.message: Amazing place to see unique art pieces of 16th-17th century. Rafaello, Caravaggio and Bernini’s masterpieces are within reach.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: It was too busy to enjoy the audioguide.
data.message: I found the inside of the museums too busy and noisy, processing people through security and getting headphones was untidy. I really feel the operation by the museum staff and your staff wasn't very organised - which is probably the system more than anything.
data.author: Linda – Australia

data.title: Saved time queing
data.message:
Very helpful in the heat of beautiful Rome
Thankyou
data.author: Jenny – United Kingdom

data.title: Amazing
data.message: Overwhelming experience in such a vast structure. Architecture is stunning worth spending as much time as you can!
data.author: Amreesh – United Kingdom

data.title: fast track was not fast at all
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: Ok experience.
data.message: It was an ok experience. We still had to stand in line. Also, so many people were inside the museum I flew like cattle going down the chute.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.message:
The experience was ok, but a bit messy and rushed
Lack of explanation regarding the map to follow the tour inside the museum and its sync with the audio guide device.
data.author: Andrea – Brazil

data.title: The fast lane was 30 minutes - other than that it was good.
data.author: Linda – Sweden

data.title: Had to wait an hour on line. Meeting place unclear
data.author: Rena – Israel

data.message: we didn't get to use our tickets to the Vatican and Sistine Chapel as we could not find the place to meet our guide until after the time of our tour. By then we were told we were too late! I would not pre-book any tours in the future because then you are committed to that time and it can be very difficult to meet at the pre-arranged place!
data.author: Mary – United States

data.title: Over crowded
data.message: We got hearded in like cows it was ridiculous you couldn’t stop for a second to look anywhere
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Nothing FAST about the fast track entry
data.message: Our tour was set to start at 930am - but we still had to wait in line for over an hour just to get inside the Vatican Museum. Our tour guide told us "It's not funny, but there is a long line to skip the line". People should be told that even though your ticket says 930am, you may not be getting inside till almost 11am.
data.author: Alexis – United States

data.title: Got in in a blink!
data.message:
Great way to skip the lines!!
Unfortunate that you need to be in a guided tour to access St Peter's Basilica through the Sistine Chapel entrance. They made us get out of Vatican City, go around its walls and enter St Peter's from the main square - dreadful queue there, even on a rainy Monday after 16:00! Wish we had realised earlier.
data.author: Χάρις – Greece

data.title: Not a skip the line trip
data.message: Our tour was scheduled from 9:30 to 11:30 - it took the tour guide exactly 1 hour and 10 min yo get us inside. We had less than an hour to run through the vatican as we had our next tour at 11:30 at St Peters B. The tour guide was inexperienced and disorganised.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Australia

data.message: We scheduled this tour to skip the line so we could get inside and enjoy the Vatican sooner. We were very disappointed! Our tour was scheduled for 9:30am and we didn’t end up getting into The Vatican till 11:00am! Definitely not what we paid for!
data.author: Andrea – Belgium

data.title: You should book this!
data.message: Professional and awesome!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – South Korea

data.title: Loved the skip the line access!
data.author: Neva – United States

data.title: spectacular but too long and you couldn't cut it short
data.author: Mary – Australia

data.title: Great
data.message: This ticket was really convenient, as the ques in that weather seemed unbearable. The fast track ticket for this price is very good as ticket sellers outside the museum seemed very questionable with their fraudulent prices.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.message: Staff are very helpful and friendly! Thank you Francesca!!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – South Africa

data.title: Money’s worth
data.message: Easy to find travel guides, clear instructions. You get your money’s worth and it is nice to have some guidance through the massive amounts of queque’s and people waiting to get in.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Netherlands

data.message: I write this vicariously. The queues to get in were massive and it was very hot so I made the decision not to do the tour. However I bumped into a couple who did do it and they said it was so crowded it was shoulder to shoulder. They also said it is disgraceful that the Vatican allow so many people in.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Australia

data.title: you are part of a human river flowing inexorably towards a marvel
data.message: Beware of severe crowding, go into this activity prepared to be crowded into small corridors and doorways. If you cannot handle that, don't go. Once you get into the Sistine chapel itself, if you can ignore the amount of people around you, it is just breathtaking... well worth the ordeal to get there in the first place...
data.author: Alon – Israel

data.title: Still have to queue
data.message: Whilst it was not the full queue, it still took over an hour in the group queue. Not a true skip the line experience
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Vatican tour
data.message: Perhaps we expected this to be more than it was but very disappointed. Guides were not interested particularly. Didn’t explain we would still have to wait forty minuites. Expensive as auto guides were not even included.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Never had a guide.
data.message: Museum was crowded and hard to figure out what was what. Never directed to a guide just pointed to staircase to start tour.l
data.author: Christina – United States

data.title: Beautiful but far too busy
data.message: No issues with the service, met guides at the meeting point and quickly taken through the security. The activity sadly was so packed with people that you can't stop to really appreciate the marbels or art work. Very claustrophobic sweaty and slow.
data.author: Stephen – United Kingdom

data.title: Still had to wait close to one hour to get in.
data.message: I paid for this tour because I was under the impression we would be able to get in right away. But I was wrong. We had to go through a line for all the other tour groups and ended up having to wait for close to an hour. We then almost got in but had to wait until the tour guide purchased all of our tickets. After passing out the tickets our tour guide told me i had to wait again for my audio guide. When I told her I am tired of waiting and dont want the audioguide anymore because this was taking too long, she told me “well just remember the regular line outside to get in is like three to four hours long.” Nice attitude! I just went in without the audioguide as i was upset. Had I known this was not an actual “skip the line” I would not have paid for this tour. I couldve gotten up early and been one of the first in line to enter and paid far less! I would not use this service again.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: Very easy to work with!
data.message: We were running late, and I was able to call the number and they answered and I got to speak to an actual person. And then they put us in the next group so they really took care of us. Easy in and out and totally worth the money!
data.author: Jill – United States

data.message: Very well organized!
data.author: Paul – Netherlands

data.title: horruble
data.message: I got in the fast track line showed the person my reservation and receipt. He told me I had to go by the stairs and look for a getyourguide person. no one showed up until 3pm when my reserved time was 2pm. The girl that came could see my reservation on her phone but she would not let me go with her group because she was doing a tour. I told her just let me go in with her then I'd go off by myself. she would not do it. Many people tried to help me that was not getyourguide but no one could. Finally after talking (in tears) to the fast track line he let me go in where I had to buy another ticket. I was so exhausted and upset by that time I could not even enjoy it. I would like my money back. Plus I'm very leary about another tour I booked in another city with this company. Is this what I am to expect when I get there too?
data.author: Kimberly – United States

data.title: Sistine chapel worth the rainy line!
data.message: We had a great time. Tour guide was a little hard to deal with in the rain....great time for the four of us tho!
data.author: Andrew – United States

data.title: Excellent
data.message: I was little late but still Get Your Guide made my entry in the next group. The entry was really fast and I managed to skip the line. Overall it was a nice experience.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Germany

data.title: Don't fall for this! You can do better on your own!
data.message:
We arrived for a 3 p.m. visit to the Sistine Chapel. It was pouring rain! Our "guide"
should have been in the LONG line already so we could enter at 3. Instead, she waited until 3 and then led us to the back of an incredibly long line to stand in the pouring rain. By the time we entered by the "fast track", it was 20 minutes later. By the time they handed us our self-using audio guides, it was 3:45. My money was ill spent. Don't let your be!
data.author: Paulette – United States

data.title: Fast track entrance was fantastic.
data.message: Fast track entrance into the Vatican Museums was a must on a very hot June day. Regular wait was approximately 3 hours. I would not recommend going to see the Sistine Chapel during the hot, busy months. There's only one way in and out and they pack you in like sardines (how is this legal?). People fainted and had panic attacks. In any case, Get Your Guide is great but perhaps there should be some type of warning about crowds, heat, and no A/C.
data.author: Suzanne – United States

data.message: We had to wait in line, other groups skipped out line
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.message: Although all was good, It would have been good to make it clearer that the guide was not part of the tour. I would have been happy to pay extra for this but it was not possible at the stage when I realised this.
data.author: Grigory – United Kingdom

data.title: Place is outstanding but too crowded
data.message: The service from GyG is very good and I recommend to buy this fast-line tickets. It’s understandable that sometimes the line takes 15 mins but compared with no fast-line tickets would be not less than one hour in the sun!! The place is remarkable and the quality of the pieces it’s like no other museums. Although is so crowded that I felt overwhelmed many times. Sixtine chapel is a must, totally worth it.
data.author: Aura – Spain

data.title: Confusing
data.message: It was difficult to find the meeting point since we were unfamiliar with Rome. When we finally got there (late) we were fast tracked (which was fine, since we were late). When we finally got into the Vatican they did not have enough tickets, so we had to wait additional time with a few other people until they could get us entrance tickets. At that point, we were left on our own to tour - no tour guide.
data.author: Elizabeth – United States

data.message: The way we were treated was an absolute disgrace. We were dumped in the foyer of the Vatican Musuem by a member of your team and left. We were given no official ticket to get through the barriers. Every musuem staff member refused us entry until we had a ticket which we were told should have been given to us by our agent. It took us a further 20 minutes to find someone who would let us through. This was supposed to be an escorted entrance booking, and this is not what we received. I will be adding this to trip advisor as a trip to highly avoid based on the way we were treated
data.author: Lisa – United Kingdom

data.message: longer than expected queue to gain entry, lack of information as to why.
data.author: Gary – United Kingdom

data.title: A must place to see
data.message: Absolutely fantastic, we spent 3 hours there, fabulous, my 14 year old daughter thought it was brilliant.
data.author: liam – Italy

data.message: you have to give an audio guide for free . €8 is a lot in case yiy you have to rent it in the Vatican
data.author: ELEFTHERIOS – Greece

data.message: It’s so crowded that it spoils the experience. Especially in the Sistine Chapel. I will never go again in the summer - maybe I will try “off season” if that exists.
data.author: joanna – United States

data.title: Everything was OK :)
data.message: I expected better safety control by the entrance. It was little bit chaotic there.
data.author: Martin – Czech Republic

data.title: Quick entry and no fuss
data.message: Very crowded. While better organized in the museum than in the past, it is still stressful.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: Totally worth it.
data.message: I was so happy to get the skip the line tickets. Totally worth it. Wish I could have had a more detailed English map and instructions but still a great experience.
data.author: Christiana

data.title: Amazing
data.message: Really busy here but got to be seen, absolutely amazing.
data.author: Cathy – United Kingdom

data.message: Remember where the meeting point is.
data.author: Stephanie – United States

data.title: Breathtaking. Guide met us as agreed
data.author: Sheila – United States

data.message: The architecture and Sistine chapel are excellent. The audio got a however did not work correctly which was disappointing for the tour.
data.author: Laura – United Kingdom

data.title: Perfect quick access
data.message: Ingenius for anyone who doesn't want a tour nor to stand in the long lines. And you get to pick your time. This service aced our trip to rome after we realized we'd left things too late. So we got to see the beautiful vatican museum and all the rest with VIP entry and audioguide. Bravo. Great service.
data.author: Jacqueline – United States

data.title: Very very busy
data.message: The place is lovely but we felt like hearded cattle, trying to make our way to the Sistine chapel there were so many people we couldn't stop to take it in as there was no room to stand still, also there are very small stair cases everyone was trying to get down which felt a little daunting.once in it was so full of people who they were hearding in to the middle as to leave room to walk round you couldn't really enjoy it, I stopped very briefly and was told to move on. Once out the other side it was quieter but by then we just wanted to leave. Beautiful place but no chance to really enjoy it
data.author: lisa – United Kingdom

data.title: A nightmare of bureaucracy
data.message: Apart from the extreme bureaucracy to get the tickets , I had to go: first, by thinking that with the code shown on the cell fone, it could be scanned, I went to the entrance and was stopped by the man in charge of the entry line, telling me that I had to get a printed ticket. He then sent me to an office that said that I had to change the ticket on the company that had issued it which was not explained when I bought it. After I found the company and wait for another 30' the ticket was only delivered inside the premisses, and after staying in line again. Like I said a nightmare which is not explained on the process of selling the ticket. I hope that you, the so called official issuers of tickets for the Vatican museum and the Sistine Chappel, as shown in the entrance sign, correct this by giving to your client the complete information on how to proceed after buying the ticket and receiving confirmation
data.author: Antonio – Brazil

data.title: Sistine Chapel amazing but priority tickets no a priority
data.author: Belinda – Australia

data.title: It would’ve been better with a tour. Hardly any signs or information
data.author: Zoe – Canada

data.message: great staff, quick entry. the addition of the audio guide is a huge plus.
data.author: Jessica – United States

data.title: Spectacular
data.message: Group of nine with kids. Easy acces to the Vatican Museum, Chapel & Vasilica. Saw hundreds of people waiting in line outside. Glad we chose this option.
data.author: Juan – Germany

data.title: Absolutely amazing
data.message: We had an amazing experience and enjoyed every minute of the visit.
data.author: Patricia – United Kingdom

data.title: Great for jumping the huge queue
data.message: The guides were easy to find, using their instructions and as a group we literally walked across the road and into the Vatican Museum where, after going through airport style security, we were given our tickets and then able to wander at will. We weren't prepared for the size of the Vatican Museum - you could spend several days there as there is so much to look at. To get to St Peter's Square and the Basilica you leave the museum and go back out on the street and walk round the walls. The queue for the church was very long and we didn't have time unfortunately, but glad we walked round to the square and saw how impressive it is. The queue for the Vatican museum had died right down at 3pm (when we left) but when we were there at 12noon, the queue was huge so fast tracking was worth it.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Quick, efficient and helpful
data.message: They were able to help us even though we missed our original slot, very kind and helpful.
data.author: Nabil – United Arab Emirates

data.title: Smooth
data.message: When we saw the queue for the Vatican.l we were so grateful we had booked. Was smooth running to get in
data.author: Poonam – United Kingdom

data.title: Practical
data.message: Practical against long queue in museum vatican especially for last minute call to visit.
data.author: Chandra – Indonesia

data.title: Easy way to enter museums with GYG
data.message: We met GYD person closed to museum. They picked up to us and guided to enter to the Museum. I like to GYG because a person who is lazy like me, GYG is the awesome way!

data.title: To get in only
data.message: This was only useful to get in but after that it’s pretty chaotic inside.

data.title: the guide has a lot of knowledge but it was too much

data.title: We got what we paid for, in time :)
data.author: Heli – Finland

data.title: Magnificent place to visit when in Rome/Vatican City
data.message:
The Vatican museum and Sistine Chapel is a must-see when in Rome. Full of rich history and art. My personal favorite was the Sistine Chapel, sat there for a long time admiring the artwork of Michelangelo.

It was definitely crowded with tourists and the weather was humid and hot. But it is definitely worth going!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Amazing
data.message: A tour guide would have been great
data.author: Colette – United Kingdom

data.title: Unorganised
data.message:
I purchased these tickets with the fast track entry also purely cause I am pregnant. On arrival to meet the team to collect tickets they were friendly and helpful. We had a booking for 3pm entry and were told to come back to them at 5 to 3. We arrived back along with a large group to stand in a que to wait to get into the Vatican we were still standing in this so called fast track que at 3.30. The girls then proceeded to hand out the tickets to everyone as we got in the inside of the building.
Of course for some reason they were 6 tickets short cause they were selling tickets to people outiside at the meeting point.
So again everyone got taken through to the museum and we were told to wait while another member of staff went and got our tickets as they were short. So by the time she went and got them etc it was after 4pm for us to get into the museum very badly organised .... the time we got in to walk about the gardens it was pouring of rain.
data.author: Meghan – United Kingdom

data.title: Great Fast Track Entry
data.message: Well worth getting the fast track tickets but be prepared for mega numbers of visitors inside. Was very hot too which is not something the booking company could cpntrol but GetYourGuide are fantastic.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.message: Meeting point exactly where they said, easy to find the guides wearing red. Nice fast entrance into the Vatican. Also booked the day before when most other companies were booked out.
data.author: Nicholas – Australia

data.title: Fantastic
data.message: Francesca, the guide, made our experience absolutely AMAZING! She was very very friendly, helpful, kind, understanding and knowledgeable. You deserve the best Francesca. May 2018

data.title: This is absolutely the way to go to visit the Sistine Chapel
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: Good

data.title: Very Crowded

Parts of the museum were unpassable as there were way too many people to really enjoy about half of the museum. Too bad, but we were glad we were able to go.

data.message: Just skip the line but when you‘re inside you have to wait for the tickets.

data.message: Chose this activity to see the Sistine chapel especially, on arrival at the chapel guards would not allow us to stop at all and we were out of the chapel in 20 seconds! So disappointed. Also pushed around by tour guides. Fast track entry worked well however.
data.author: Elizabeth – United Kingdom

data.title: The ticket was convenient, allowing us to skip the long lines.
data.message: We had no problem locating where to get the tickets, and were glad to skip the lines by the ticket office. We went right in by the groups enterance.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: Josephine was wonderful for touring Colosseo on June 10 from 11 or 12
data.message: Our guide was VERY KIND and VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE !! Great tour!
data.author: Elizabeth – United States

data.title: Very good program and very excellent staff
data.message:
Special thanks to coordinator, Ms Maria Laura.
We, whole family planned to visit on 15/6/18, 3:30pm, but as I am not familiar with the online booking system, I wrongly booked or 16/6/18, 3:30pm trip but I did not aware of it until I arrived at the venue.
My family members were very disappointed.
Fortunately, Laura coordinated with customer services to advanced my appointment by one day so that can join the program on 15/6/18 and no need to miss it as we could not come back again on 16/6/18.
So, once again, I and my family members would like to express our greatest gratitude and appreciation towards Ms Maria Laura.

data.title: It was such an awe-inspiring visit!

data.message: Not worth the money

data.title: One of two my tickets for this has been canceled without any reasons.

data.title: Fast track is excellent thank you

data.title: This was a great way to quickly enter and explore the museum.

data.title: Friendly staff, but 40 minutes to get in
data.message: At 9:30am the fast-track lane was huge, it took 40 minutes to get in, but the regular lane was much more longer. We have finished our own tour at 14:00 and the fast-track lane was empty. At the biginning the staff told usefull informations, so overall the service worth the money.

data.title: fantastic
data.message:
beautiful surroundings and fabulous museums. as lots if people book fast track entry it does not actually get you in straight away. still expect to queue an hour.

when we left, we did notice there were no queues. so I recommend visiting in the afternoon instead of morning

data.title: Everything was alright
data.message: The timetable was in order. Team get your guide too.

data.title: Skip the line is a must but it was too crowded to enjoh
data.message: Skip the line is definitely a must when visiting the Vatican otherwise you will wait 2-3 hours. It was incredible to be inside but if you don’t like crowded places I would suggest thinking twice about going. It was difficult to enjoy with many tourists pushing past and just being outright rude. Other than that I would suggest this if you do plan on going as you won’t need to wait to get in.

data.message: We arrived 5 minutes late due to being sent to the wrong line and told to queue, they refused us entry and told us to wait and see if there was room on the next tour. There was no guarantee of entry and due to my husband having cancer standing around in 30 degree heat wasn’t an option !! £60 totally wasted, I am very angry and disappointed.

data.title: Terrible visit at the vatican. overcrowded

data.title: A great way to see the Vatican on limited time.

data.title: Very helpful, impressive multi lingual staff

data.title: Great
data.message: Great

We had been advised to book in advance to save queuing time - this was definitely the case.
Due to the huge amount of people in and around the queues, it was very chaotic - my criticism would be that once inside, the guide was not able to brief everyone because of the amount of noise, therefore, we missed most of the tips. None the less, definitely worth booking this skip the line ticket in advance.

data.title: Crowded beyond belief.

data.message: Paid a little more but worth it to skip the lines. Very well organized and easy to find.

I could have got there 20 mins earlier and I would have been near the front of the "come on your own que"

data.title: To busy, felt like hearded cattle.

We paid extra for audio but were unable to access it because the guides were gone so we had to pay for it AGAIN. We are very unhappy by the lack of service provided. We did show ourselves around, but it ended up costing us a lot more money and we were missing context most of the way through. We did not receive what we paid for at all.

data.message:
The Museums were beautiful and there is so much to see but... the audio guide was NOT worth the money!! Just buy the ticket without the guide, it’s much better, honestly :)

Los museos son hermosos y hay tantas pinturas y esculturas que ver pero... la audio guía no vale esa cantidad de dinero. Es mucho mejor hacerlo sin ella!! :)

data.title: Fantastic all went very smoothly and friendly

Please note that this is not a guided tour.
Once you are inside you need to explore on your own.
Headset costs 5euros

data.title: Good choice!

data.title: Beat the que not quite the correct title

So not only did we miss the best part of the tour, but we then paid again for the pleasure. Not good.
The museum itself is spectacular, but this purchase was only average.

data.message: Had a great experience. Be sure to be ontime.

data.title: The Vatican City Tours

data.author: CAROLINE – United Kingdom

data.title: Best way to avoid the ques hassle free
data.author: Carol – United Kingdom

data.title: Highly recommended but essential to pre-book fast track entry
data.message:
If you are thinking of visiting the Vatican Museums and the Sistine Chapel pre booking this fast track entry option is essential. We arrived to find a massive queue for those who had not done this but we were inside and enjoying the galleries within 10 minutes. If you are taking a guided tour be sure to book this officially at the same time as you will be stopped very often by unofficial 'guides' trying to sell you their tours!

We didn't book an official tour, just made our way on our own as we prefer to take our time and discover the treasures ourselves and as everything was very well signed and labelled, we had no problems finding our way around all of the amazing galleries and artwork that is available to view. Absolutely incredible!

Allow at least 2 hours but it gets extremely busy, we took over 3, time to marvel at everything!

Avoid the cafe! Overpriced and not good value!

We highly recommend a visit, it is awesome, breathtaking, unmissable and a truly wonderful experience.
data.author: Lesley – United Kingdom

data.title: Surprising being on my own once I entered the Vatican museum.
data.author: Alexandra – Italy

data.message:
It worked and everything was on time. You have access to all the museums but not the gardens. Nothing to do with get your guide but itinerary inside the museums is not 100% clear.
For the basilica you have to take the right door when exiting the chapelle sistine even though it seems to be reserved for groups. We missed it the first time and had to go back through the museums and the chapelle. Also note that once you exit for the basilica you cannot return to the museums. If you miss the basilica you can always go back by making the way all around the piazza san pietro.

data.message: Though this is definitely worthwhile for saving time, there needs to be a limit to how many people are allowed inside at once. It was so crowded we literally could not move. This takes enjoyment and respect to the surroundings away and it made me feel that they were only in it for the money. Also, I was disappointed by how rude the staff was in the Sistine Chapel.

We followed her into the museum building but were behind at security and and lost her. We tried all the ticket places and they said it was GetYourGuides responsibility and would not let us in, or give us a ticket and said all we could do was buy the tickets again. We did not see the museums or the Sistine Chapel in spite of paying for Skip the Line tickets.

data.title: Not waiting in a long line for hours was the best

Essentially, you are paying just to get in ahead of the lines and that's about it. This early entrance was easy to book and the tickets printed out without any glitches. The guides were very nice and they did their job getting us inside. I gave this 4 stars b/c we didn't get inside until 20-30 min past our entrance time. Its a little pricey for someone to just walk you in but if you don't want to spend your entire day standing in the world's longest line, the early entrance is for you.

data.title: slightly chaotic
data.message: It was well worth paying the extra with GYG to have fast track, as the queue was quite long to get into the entrance. It was easy to find the "start" - which was on some steps opposite the main entrance, but the guide starting giving instructions before everyone has assembled. Once inside, past the security check, we almost lost her. However, after finding her, it became clear and we went to the first floor to get our audio guides. Those without audio guides carried on to the entrance. Although this tour did not come with a physical guide, it was well worth paying the extra for the audio guide, as we could stop and listen to what we wanted to. The Vatican Museums is absolutely amazing and the Sistine Chapel as the end was almost an anti-climax after seeing the Vatican rooms. An absolute must and the highlight of Rome for my husband. Well worth doing, you won't be disappointed.

We still had to queue for about 20min to get in the Vatican, which was ok since the standard queue had over 3h waiting time! Alessia and Giulia were great hosts. They kept the group together and the entrance happened without any problems, although it was really busy!

On a side note, the Vatican Musei are really interesting but with an awful organization. When it’s too crowded, you have absolutely no choice but to follow the crowd through the corridors with no time to appreciate the paintings, sculptures and tapestries.

A heads-up: you’ll have to go through the entire museum in order to get to the Sistine Chapel. There’s a “short” path, which will still take at least 2h to go through.

data.message: Do not queue to enter. Skip the line is well worth the couple of Euro you'll spend. Also, once done with the museum tour, exit to St Peter's Basillica through the Sistene Chappell, do not exit the museum and reenter - the queue is likely to hold you up for hours!

data.title: Missed the queue and went at own pace. Good for us

data.title: Fast track pass is brilliant!
data.message: Really straight forward and saved us a lot of queing! Very easy to exchange voucher for tickets once in main reception area of Vatican Museum-would absolutely recommend this method to everyone traveling to Rome
data.author: Hannah – Ireland

data.title: Crowded, crowded, crowded
data.message:
I guess it’s a bucket list thing, so I’m glad I saw it. But they really need to limit how many people can go in at once.

Compared to the L’ouvre the art and artifacts are pretty meh. The groups are nearly impossible to get past and move at a snails pace in the narrow hallways.

If you have any fantasy of seeing the the Sistine Chapel ceiling and looking up in silent awe, throw that idea out the window after you set it on fire. The room is packed with a few HUNDRED people who are all taking even though you hear Vatican employees shushing them constantly. People are taking pictures even though they were told not to. Finally, because of more lax hygiene in Europe the hot room smells like a sweaty armpit.

Like I said, see it for your bucket list, but don’t be fooled into thinking you’ll get any quiet contemplation. This was by far the busiest thing I’ve been to in all of Europe (L’ourve, Eiffel, Rodin, Duomo, Roman forums, Pompeii, etc.)
data.author: Steve – United States

data.title: Awful customer service
data.message: We struggled to find the meeting point as vatican is huge, and not having been to Rome before it was difficult to follow directions. Stopped many times on way to meeting point by staff asking us if we had a ticket or street sellers stopping us we arrived at 11.34 for an 11.30 guide. The staff (bruno) wouldn't radio across to our tour who at that time would still have been in the line which we could have joined and there wasn't any space to move us to 12pm guide. We then had to pay another €17 each (party of 4) to visit the vatican & sistine chapel. Lack of customer service, not very helpful at all. If i had got there at 12pm i could understand but 4 minutes late when our tour would still have been in line was very unhelpful & unfair. Need to be more organised as in Collosseum.

data.title: So hot, less queuing, happy visitors

data.author: Konstantinos – Greece

data.title: not "fast"-track entry
data.message: We arrived at our scheduled pre-entry checkpoint early and waited, then entered a slow-moving line and waited, then entered the building and waited, then entered another line for our audio guides and waited, and then finally entered the museum. It appeared that the next-scheduled Get Your Guide group was right behind us in line for audioguides--indeed, almost skipping in front of us. In all, the amount of waiting proved to devalue this product well below what it was worth. Furthermore, it was not made clear to us in online marketing that the "guide" portion of this Get Your Guide would be the Vatican Museum's own supply of audioguides. I figure the 13-euro extra per person spent for this Get Your Guide pass was not worth all the waiting. I would not recommend this to anyone in the future unless they find themselves in a similar situation as us--without ability to purchase tickets due to enormous number of similarly-sketchy organizations scalping museum tickets to unsuspecting tourists.

data.message: Once we got there, l thought we could just scan the bar could we were sent to gain entry. But instead we were told we had to find the “Get your Guide” person - and I kept insisting we hadn’t signed up with a tour guide, and it was very confusing. We did a lot of needless walking around trying to figure out how to gain entry. Finally, someone told us to walk down a street and then half a flight of steps to find the actual “Get your Guide Person” at the appointed time. They then led a group of about 40 people all with the same appointed time to the entrance where they then gave us paper tickets so we could gain entry. We again had to follow the guide inside where they then distributed audio guides - but not with headphones. You had to hold them to your ear and try to hear what was being said over the noise of the crowd (it was packed). What a scam!
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer

data.title: This did exactly what it said on the box - fast track entry- great
data.message: This did exactly what it said - got us fast track entry to the Vatican Museums, pleased we did it as the lines for 'normal' entry were enormous.
data.author: Stephen – United Kingdom

data.title: Instruction on how to redeem the tickets were not clear
data.message: The instruction said that the meeting point was “go straight to the security guards and show our passes to get to security check” but when we did that, we were turned away. The guards told us that for this company, we needed to meet the Get Your Guide person 15 mins before the scheduled time and they will walk you in as a group. However, we went to the actual meeting point, which was across the street, there was no one. We also ran into another couple that had the same problem. We ended up paying again for another tour in order to get in since the line to get into the City had a 2.5hr wait. We also found out later that the actually voucher for the tickets to get in was different from what was added to your “wallet app”. However, I emailed the company about the issue and they were able to resolve it within 24hr! We wish the instruction was clearer so we didn’t have to waste time running around and figuring out how to get in.

data.message: no audio guide (guidance with headphones) included

data.title: Mis-sold
data.message:
The time slot offered shouldn’t have been sold at all because with Sistine Chapel closing at 5pm- we had very little time to actually see anything in the museum without rushing. I felt that this service was certainly mis-sold to us and had all this been mentioned at time of booking I would not have spent 40 euros just to get a glimpse.

My friend and I actually arrived before our time slot and the guides refused to give us our tickets till our time slot even though all they did was literally chaperone us through the doors. Honestly that extra time would’ve made all the difference!

It’s a shame we didn’t get to fully appreciate this as both the Vatican museum and Sistine chapel are truly magnificent.

data.title: Great Service - Got our tickets fast!
data.message: I was skeptical at first due to some mixed reviews, but since the Vatican tickets were sold out on the main website for +9 people, I had no other choice but to use an outside vendor. I am SO happy to have found this company. It was easy to find their location (I suggest downloading their mobile app as the features are helpful in finding the meeting location and presenting your mobile tickets , no need to print!) the Guides were clear in the process and the best part of all is we bypassed that gigantic line that wrapped around the Vatican wall, waited maybe 5 minutes inside, got our tickets and were on our way. There really isn't anything better you can ask for. The queue inside was not long (seriously, less than 5 minutes) and you were in. It may be a little more expensive but if the Vatican sells out, this is a must - don't wait in that wretched line.

data.title: Busy
data.message:
Loved the Vatican museums & Sistine chapel.There are so many options for tours but this one suited us.
It was a self guided tour.
Meeting point was easy to find, the lady explained what was going to happen. Skipped the line ( A MUST ) &queued at the entrance went though a security check, then waited for the guide to pass out our headset & audio.We had already purchased them in our ticket price, better to do this as it seemed a lot of hassle to get them once you was there.you was then free to wander around at leisure. Downside, although the information was very informative, we found it all over bearing and to much information. I'm sure if you are up on art etc... The info wouldn't have been enough! It was also very very busy and I mean busy, steady flowing people but moving all the time and hard to stop and enjoy some of the works of art. We visited in march around 11am!!! ....to many people. Options: go early as you can. Vatican is shut on sunday and Monday.

fast track started of well with everybody being put into a queue and the sorted into groups of different languages. After that it went down hill ,unless you were very close to the guide you could not make out what she was saying . Worst of all once you got into the vatian where they then gave you your tickets . You could not hear the guide calling out your name to collect your tickets due to all the other groups and visitors being there at the same time very very loud.
and no map so you spent a lot of time trying to get to other locations which were very badly sign posted . The vatican hower is well worth the visit but get an auto guide with map.

3 stars only because the Audio Guide was ok.

data.title: Be prepared for crowds

The only negative I can say is not against the tour company ... it's more of an observation... I think ANYTIME you go... no matter what time of year ... It will ALWAYS be busy with lots of people! The part when you are getting closer to the Sistine Chapel seems to go on forever and is jam-packed the whole way... meaning you cannot jump ahead of people and the walk is like a crawl. In the Sistine Chapel, it is wall to wall people and really hard to enjoy yourself... but hey... when in Rome ... it's a must!

The tickets were well worth it as the huge queue wasn't even moving when we arrived.
However, you had to meet a guide across the road, then you had to wait for everyone to arrive. You all had to walk through the security together and meet afterwards. Then wait for everyone. Then they went down the list and called out peoples names, THEN you got your tickets and were allowed to go off and explore.
A long winded process for no reason.
Also, they didn't supply a map.

data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – Romania

data.title: Quick entry but could have explained more
data.message:
We paid around €35 each to enter with an audio guide. (Tickets for the Vatican are €17 so you pay double to queue jump basically) Entry was quick and easy with no queuing, but once in there was a bit of a scramble at the desk and very little explanation on how to use the audio guide. We worked it out ok but people who are less into technology may like a quick demo.
Our entry time was 3pm and the last entry to the Cistine Chapel was 5.30. I would recommend to enter early so you don’t have to rush. The audio guide was very useful though.
Overall it’s worth paying , even if it is double, to skip the queue and of course to see the beauty of the Vatican and St Peter’s.
I’ve been before and had a guided tour. I would recommend anyone to do this with a reputable company. The guides are very knowledgable and explain everything as they take you through. It’s the best way to see it.
Book before you go as we left it too late to get a guide. Check reviews!

data.title: We were not able to see the basilica due to poor and wrong information

We asked employees who pointed us the wrong way. At the point we knew we needed to go another way the security guard forced us to wait at the line on the street. After waiting there 1.5 hours and eating dinner in the line, we did not make the cut off to go through security again and see the church.

I strongly suggest get your guide provide maps to navigate through.

data.title: Quick entry, self-guided Vatican tour
data.message: We used this fast-track entry to wait in a shorter line to enter the Vatican. The guides were knowledgeable and spoke 5 different languages -- crazy!! They got us in fairly quickly, though there was definitely still a line. However, we went on a Tuesday and the Vatican is closed on Sundays and Mondays, so I think that was why it was so busy that day. Avoid that day if you can help it! This was a self-guided tour, but the Get Your Guide rep was willing to help with audio guides if you wanted them (though I wouldn't bother -- it's too loud and busy in the Vatican Museums to hear your audio guide anyway). I would bring a Rick Steves written guide or something similar instead so you can look at the highlights. Make sure to save time for Raphael's rooms, the Sistine Chapel, and St. Peter's Basilica -- all of those are at the end of the Vatican Museums self-guided tour.

data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United Kingdom

data.title: Fast track is a must!
data.message:
If you are ever visiting Rome for just couple of days like we did then the fast track entry is a must! Despite being aware of the never ending queues for Vatican it was on our 'must visit list and we decided to give a go to the fast track ticket on the morning of our visit to make the most of our stay as we were only there for 2 full days. It proved to be worth every penny! we were met by the very friendly GYG team at the agreed spot & time. We were then rounded up with the rest of the travellers, ticked off the list (no printed voucher was required as the confirmation on the app was enough) and then taken inside for the ticket collection. And off we went!
We decided to buy an audio guide but was a little disappointed as it only read out descriptions of exhibits (which you ciuld read out from boards anyway) and didn't give any additional information of the Vatican & it's life/events/people itself.
Prep yourself for a minimum of 4hrs visit but worth the effort and time!

Beautiful place to visit!

DO NOT book last admission (3:30). It was extremely busy, so by the time you get to the Sistine Chapel its full with people and you re being pushed and employees blow whistles(?!) to direct ppl... It is not how I wanted to see Michelangelo's' biggest works, but hey... at least I have been there :)
Go but with a different (cheaper) ticket maybe.

Unfortunately there is a partial upstairs area and a full upstairs area the guide said 'Go up the stairs' once fully upstairs to the museums we realized we needed to be in a different area to meet our guide. Now we knew why we saw 3 different groups of people in our tour group running down the stairs frantically. Too late. By the time we figured it out, and went back downstairs our group was gone so we paid an addition 7 euros for the audio guide. We were sad. We sent an email in hopes for a partial refund but still have not heard back

data.title: Great option! Saved time in line.
data.message:
So we went too early at the meeting point just in case...
We found the support staff very easy and they were great.
(Tip #1: No need to go too early!!! We ended up waiting too long, got ripped off from the overpriced, low quality restaurant across the street since we were hungry.)

No need for print-outs, maps etc....
Just install the app on your mobile.
(Tip #2: Have a battery pack with you.)

We even got an audio guide.
(Tip #3: Have a pair of headphones with you; your mobile ones work just fine.... so you can take pictures and enjoy the museum.)

Very crowded on Saturday
(Tip #4: Wouldn't suggest a guide. When too crowded or a big team can't hear a thing. Use the audio guide. Can hear and replay everything at your own pace.)

data.title: Effective, but needed?
data.message:
We didn´t have much time so we went for a skip-the-line-ticket. It´s quite easy. You meet up on the steps outside the Vatican, you are teken through with a guide past the lines and then given the ticket. The whole process took us about 30 min from the meeting time. So far, so good!

The only thing is - was it needed? The regular que is quite fast outside the Vatican and when we got out again there was almost no que. We could probably have saved money not buying the skip-the-line.

But - I guess if you´re in a hurry it might be worth it...

data.title: Fast-Track made all the difference.
data.message: My travelling companion and I had heard that the line-ups at the Vatican Museums were long, but nothing had prepared us for the throngs of people waiting to be admitted. In addition to the crowds, the heat was unbearable and I do not know what we would have done if we had not arrived with our Fast-Track passes in tow. The young people who guided us into the museum were friendly, charming, and highly professional. Each of them appeared to be multilingual, they explained the procedures we would be going through clearly, and they got us to where we wanted to be without a hitch. We got into the Vatican Museums way ahead of the poor souls who were waiting patiently and baking in the heat outside. Buying the Fast-Track pass was money well spent.

data.title: So much beauty and history in one small place
data.message: I've wanted to come to Rome for about 20 years now. It definitely didn't disappoint. The Sistine chapel is beautiful as are the museums surrounding it. Unfortunately there were very disrespectful people who weren't quiet in the chapel and there were far too many people allowed inside the chapel at the one time. This did take away from the experience a bit which is a shame. It is very hot walking through the museums and I think a designated walking route might be helpful especially to those that love congregating in the middle of a walk way to figure out which way they're going. I am pleased that I went and saw it with my own eyes, I can finally say I did it after 20 years. Absolutely stunning history. The get your guide fast track admission was a great idea, saves plenty of time especially as we still had many other things to see in the afternoon. I'm glad we didn't wait in line, especially inthe heat!

I will go again but will get my own ticket when I arrive. My advice is get there really early and get around before the crowds. Our get your guide should have got us maps when she got the tickets. But she just sent us on our way and when I realised a map would have been useful it was too busy to go back. Also we wernt given the choice of audio which some visitors were using and seemed a great idea. So do your research yourself and get there early. O and Get A Map

Only issue we had was finding the meeting point, it told us the arch of Constantine and we arrived half an hour early. We did a another tour with get your guide the day before at the Vatican and it was easy to find with the guide holding up a red getyourguide sign. However on this tour the guides at the meeting point had a pink ribbon with a heart on it. Just by chance we asked a guide if they knew were GetYourGuide would be and it turned out it was them. The tour also left 10 mins early therefore if we hadn't arrived half a hour before we would have missed the tour due to the unclear signs.

data.title: The extra cost is way better than standing in lines!
data.message:
This is perfect for anyone who wants a chilled day at the vatican. I would recommend getting an early entry as there is loads to do and you can spend the whole day in there.

First we met the GetYourGuide reps who were really nice and helped us out quite a lot. You are provided with someone who speaks your language who then explains how everything is going to work.

They then take you into the vatican, through the security, and then they get your tickets for you, which saves you from lining up and getting your own tickets.

The process was really quick and it saved a lot of time. All in all, we were in the vatican with tickets in under 30 minutes.

Paying a little extra to get someone else to organise everything for you is definitely worth it as the lines were ridiculously long!

Highly Recommended!!

data.message:
The museum and chapel is definately worth a visit when in Rome.
We had bought Fast track with audioguide tickets, but it took quite a long time to get in and we didnt seem to move any faster than everybody else.
Also had to wait for a reduction in price for kids. The guides (and kids) went to another counter and spoke with an employee and then came back some minutes after. Not sure, what the reduction was or if we got it?? Bit confusing and didnt seem very well organized. Why not correct price immediately when you buy the tickets online?? Seemed a bit messy.
Besides the not so fast entrance and the reduced price for kids thing, everything went well.

Best way to use this ticket is to go into the Vatican museum and end the visit with the Sistine chapel as there is a door that leads straight into St. Peter's Basilica so you avoid the huge que going in. However the door from the chapel may not always be open, so it's worth checking before deciding to go through that route.

data.title: It was easy to find the guides and the directions were on point.
data.message: These skip the line fast-track tickets were definitely worth the price, especially in this 90+ degree weather and not to mention it rained unexpectedly and we were lucky enough to get into the museum without waiting outside. Security was fast and once you're in, the guide hands out each party's tickets as soon as possible.
data.author: a GetYourGuide customer – United States

data.title: You can't beat every queue.
data.message:
Meeting point was exactly where it shows on the app and easily accessible on public transport followed by a short walk.
Price gets you admission but still includes some queueing as there are many fast track competitors.
Inside the entrance, just after security, is very cramped and very busy with no seating available while the rep buys the tickets from the ticket office (these should really be prepurchased in my opinion).
Inside the museum tho it can be manic. So hot and crowded in some hallways with bottle necks everywhere. They really should try and limit numbers or crowd control certain areas.
Recommended as the normal queue for tickets can be ridiculous, especially on a Wednesday when the pope is present. Can't fault the reps (apart from the tickets issue) , it's the Vatican Museum itself which needs to address overcrowding and respite areas.
